author: Max
comments: Stay was great, everything was within walking distance however the directions to the actual property were a bit unclear. It was confusing to navigate 55 Bremner and 65 Bremner once inside  as the two buildings are connected and there are no signs stating or showing directions and the keys for 55 Bremner are in 65 Bremner

author: Miah
comments: This place was in the heart of Toronto! So close to everything! Shopping, site seeing, food, and more! Super clean and stylish place! The views are absolutely stunning too! Will definitely be back!

author: Tyler
comments: This condo is an incredible location in downtown Toronto with some incredible views of the city! From this unit, you’re pretty much able to walk anywhere in the vicinity of downtown. I would stay here again on my next visit to Toronto!

author: Emmanuel
comments: Outstanding place and perfect location for one or two people looking to stay in the heart of Downtown Toronto.

author: Alicia
comments: Great place at a great location!

author: Lalji
comments: a greal location, easy check in and clean place

author: Kendra
comments: Perfect location adjacent to the Arena and near a few restaurants, grocery store, etc.  A residential condo building with access to the pool, jacuzzi,  and gym. Different towers within the residence made directions confusing but we discovered a easier way to get to the condo without rerouting through a different floor. Otherwise as expected. A 1 bedroom small studio, stylish and modern but not very roomy.  Very small but doable. We were a group of 4 travelling for Caribana and werent inside much.

author: David
comments: The condo is on the 35th fl with a terrific view.  It is clean,  stylish and in a great location!  The building was safe and check in through KeyCafe was much simpler than I anticipated.

author: Russell
comments: Amazing location.  Walking distance to ScotiaBank Arena, The Rogers Center, the CN Tower and the water.

author: Jan
comments: We arrived the night before the Raptors first NBA finals game. This location could not have been more perfect for us, not only for the Raptors/NBA action (stood right out front for all the first half!), but also so beautifully located within Toronto.  I plan to return with my husband to Toronto, for a full pleasure (no business) trip, and hope we can stay here again.  While small, it was all we needed and the staff at the building were helpful and informative.  Even the cleaning crew (which had not been informed of our noon check-out), were kind and full of hospitality when they arrived and we were not yet gone.  This was a terrific experience and I thank you so much!

author: Rishabh
comments: Great location, very nice apartment. You might hear little construction noise (not much) in bedroom from outside, other than that really nice place. Big TV with Netflix, amazon prime included. Alper is very fast in responding to messages too. I would definitely recommend this place.

author: Marcus
comments: Very stylist place. Great location for everything. Great view

author: Ariella
comments: A clean nice place withe beautiful views and in walking distance to everything!

author: Brianna
comments: Super stylish and clean! Close to downtown!!

author: Joelle
comments: This location in Toronto is PERFECT!  Great view, super close to all things we were interested in seeing and a block away from a Sobey's, which is a fantastic grocery store.  The only thing we wish we knew about previous to going was that the mattress was really firm.  It was actually shockingly firm.  I guess some people like that sort of thing, but we are more into a squishier (word?) mattress.  We ended up purchasing a mattress pillow top because we knew we wouldn't be able to sleep well for the rest of our stay and everything was fine.  Alper responds quickly and was very helpful with a TV issue we had (one of the clickers was under the couch, which we found and everything worked fine after that).  All in all we would rent this space again (which we probably will in the summer to go to a Blue Jays game), but we'll bring our pillow topper with us!

author: Louis
comments: This beautiful apartment is located in the middle of downtown Toronto. It’s super clean wonderful place to stay, if you’re booking this place you Will enjoy it. Parking is such a convince so many places to go to that are so close to This amazing apartment. The view is amazing I had a wonderful time.

author: Kevonna
comments: Highly recommend staying here! The View is amazing

author: Tiffany
comments: Good location, clean and comfortable apartment. Looked a bit bigger in photos, but overall great place to stay and great host!

author: Dan
comments: Absolutely stunning views of downtown Toronto. Clean and modern unit. Alper was very friendly and helpful throughout my stay.

author: Jess
comments: Fantastic location and price for area! Couch bed was a futon, shower was amazing, bed was a little hard but comfy to sleep on. Overall place was VERY clean. Nothing extra was stocked, so buy food/drinks/anything needed besides the necessities.

author: Ammar
comments: Jeffery was an amazing host! Communication was on point! Would definitely come back to stay in his home!

author: Thomas
comments: Such a great experience at Jeffrey’s condo. Easy check-in, spotless conditions- everything you need to make yourself at home ( & then some). If you want to be in the middle of everything , this it. Also enjoy one of the comfiest beds around

author: Janna
comments: We were able to walk to so many places from this location! I had never stayed in a high rise before and this was a really cool way to do it. It was cozy, sparkling clean, and romantic.

author: Adrian
comments: Lovely place, modern and chic with a stunning view onto Yonge and Dundas

author: Carson
comments: A little bit smaller than you'd expect, but still a great spot! Very comfortable bed, incredibly convenient / easy to access anything you'd need. Particularly great for business travel.

author: Tyler
comments: Place was wonderful with a beautiful view. Had everything we needed and the place was very clean.

author: Brian
comments: Jeffrey was an incredible host.  His place has a fabulous view on the 40th floor right in the middle of downtown Toronto 1 block away the Eaton Centre and close to everything we wanted

author: Matt
comments: Another great stay in Toronto! Jeffery makes our stay a breeze by making check-in super simple. The condo has amazing views and is comfortable and luxurious.

author: Sonya
comments: Absolutely wonderful! Condo was clean and very conveniently located. No issues with noise and very easy to check in and out. We could either walk to everything or Uber to where we needed to go. Jeffrey was an amazing host

author: Matt
comments: Phenomenal condo with incredible sweeping views of downtown Toronto. Beautifully appointed with all the amenities of home! Super easy check-in and check-out and the location is UNbeatable.

author: Sham
comments: Very nice condo

author: Brittney
comments: This place was perfect for what we needed. It was super clean and Johnny was very good at responding.

author: Madi
comments: An absolutely gorgeous stay, you won’t be disappointed!

author: Ashley
comments: It was as expected, nice location, fair price.

author: Lauryn
comments: A had a great Air Bnb experience.  Johnny was super on point w/check-in instructions and a very thoughtout apt layout which included all the amenities, even delicious free coffee.  The pool, view and location were just added bonuses.  I will recommend it to others and stay again.

author: Cory
comments: Excellent value and great location. Would stay again.

author: Carissa
comments: This space was a perfect location for a downtown long weekend. We were able to walk to several nearby restaurants and felt safe in the neighborhood. Very close to groceries and restaurants. The building did appear to be younger, college aged folks and you could hear dogs barking or chatting in the halls/neighboring rooms. The balcony is a lovely space to be able to enjoy the breeze and step out for a quick view. The access to pool and hot tub are a nice amenitily here, although we did not use either so I cannot speak to them. The building has an alert and active security team who were friendly and helped enter the building if we needed. Johnny was a wonderfully gracious host and was very responsive to any messages or inquiries. I would stay here again if ever to return to Toronto.

author: Karlee
comments: Great view, easy check in. Perfect for a couple of people, a little tight with 4 but the view definitely made it worth it for us. Loved having the washer and dryer. Easy check in. Overal 10/10

author: James
comments: Only stayed here for a night as a hold over while waiting on our plane. Johnny was incredibly helpful in advance with local suggestions. Clean, well kept room with easy check in and great view. Several small amenities that made a huge difference. Washer and dryer with detergent was a life saver after several days of snow activities with limited number of socks. Strong recommend to anyone.

author: Reign
comments: Great stay! I would highly recommend.

author: Joe
comments: Great view of the city

author: Josie
comments: Laura's lovely apartment is ideally located for the theatre district and was ABSOLUTELY gorgeous. Awesome layout, lovely clean decor, and a super comfy bed, all in a terrific neighborhood. We had a little bit of trouble with the lockbox and Laura's response and problem solving were instantaneous and effective. She is a gracious host and super helpful. We couldn't recommend this spot more enthusiastically!

author: Yannick
comments: Very happy with the accommodation - everything was clean, location and amenities were great, and Laura was very responsive to any questions or requests we had.  Recommended!

author: Mark
comments: A comfortable reasonably priced place in an excellent location in Toronto. A great check in process and excellent communication from the host. Highly recommend this place.

author: Yasemin
comments: Great location, cute place!

author: Shaina
comments: Laura's loft was in a great area of Toronto. A little bit difficult to find for us country people, but once we navigated and found everything we didnt have to use our vehicle again. We were able to walk to anything we sought out. The space was clean and decorated beautifully.  We would definitely stay here again.

author: Christian
comments: A very cozy and comfortable complex located within walking distance of the city centre.

author: Tara
comments: Great space! Super clean, beautiful apartment. Perfect for 2 people, easy walk to many great restaurants and shops. Great neighborhood!

author: David
comments: Great way to travel and Laura is an awesome host to deal with.

author: Tracey
comments: A perfect nest for a weekend in the city, right in the middle of everything!

author: Ramin
comments: Great space! Clean and cozy!

author: Phillip
comments: Clean and nice, but wifi is very slow and neighbors were loud every night. Location is solid. Shower was decent

author: Evan
comments: Good place to stay! And close to lots of awesome places in Toronto.

author: Dany
comments: The hot water doesn't work and I reported this, but to no avail. I  requested to stay an hour extra, but I was kicked out in the snow storm. How rude and inconsiderate. I requested the night before when I noticed my brother would be running late in picking me up...

author: James
comments: Great location, was clean to perfection, and even had soap available. Made my first trip to Toronto a good one. There is no tv, but as a tech guy I think this helped. Made me want to go out and explore the town more. The location is within a 25 walk of the major museums and street cars and other transit are close by . Very secure and the front door to the building is locked . Felt very safe at night . Only negative thing I can say was the toilet paper roll holder was broke. . Thanks for a great stay .  Will definitely come again.

author: Caitlin
comments: We had a fantastic time in Toronto! Our stay was good, however the space was a little smaller then we expected, and not extremely personal as we would have liked. The space was clean, and the view was nice, and did suit our last minute trip well however! Definitely would recommend for a short stay.

author: Angelo
comments: awesome stay. great place for a single person, couple, or small group of friends/family. very clean and an absolutely perfect location. walls are thin and the neighbors were inconsiderate of that, but that’s not to the fault of the host. best stay i’ve had in toronto.

author: Jenny
comments: Great area!

author: Jessie
comments: Nice comfy place

author: Kevin
comments: Place was very clean and check in was super easy.

author: Luiz
comments:
Modern studio, very clean and fully stocked with complementary items and items that could  be purchased ( this was very convenient for me ) 
Very attentive host easy check in and check out great location close to all restaurants,  bars &  stores. 
Will definitely be back! 
Thank you Ivy

author: Brijen
comments: Very clean and fun place great place to stay would do it all over again

author: Shaun
comments: Ivy is a super hot! My flight was delayed and I checked in way later than planned and Ivy was so helpful and quick to respond to make sure I was able to get checked in.

author: Malcolm
comments: Ivy was a great host. The communication was fast and efficient. The check in process was smooth and she was very accommodating. I was only there for one night but it was an effortless process. She also had any and everything you could need within the property.

author: Rafael
comments: Yvana was great, accessible and very responsive. The place is immaculate.

author: David
comments: All good but the bed is small for two people.

author: Erica
comments: Great place in a great location. Recommend for business trips.

author: Kristen
comments: Easy check in, fantastic location, and absolutely spotless - a perfect stay. The place is bright with floor-to-ceiling windows perfect for watching a snowstorm roll in :) I was very impressed with how clean and well-laid out the place is. Ivy is extremely responsive and a top notch host -- our flight got cancelled due to weather woes and she was super communicative and flexible.

author: Kevin
comments: Condo was excellent. Great location between King st and Queen st. Well appointed with a beautiful view.

author: Coby
comments: Excellent space in an unbelievably convenient location. Highly reccommend!

author: Faris
comments: Great place!

author: James
comments: Great place to stay! Beautiful interior.

author: Austin
comments: Rolyn's place is great and in a nice part of town. He's very responsive and great. Two things I would point out for others: 1) there is no WiFi in the apartment. That is on purpose, but just make sure you are aware of that. 2) At night you'll have to park in either a parking garage nearby or on another street a block or two away. Not an issue, and we found parking really easily, but be aware of that. All in all his place was great and I would recommend.

author: Melih
comments: We had a great time at Rolyn's place. He was kind and gave us a nice tour of the apartment when we showed up. I would definitely stay there again.

author: Alysia
comments: Beautifully clean, comfortable bed and the host is very sweet and friendly. No Wi-Fi here, no Netflix/hardlined access through TV and nobody claims otherwise... but the old school DVD option is kinda homey. For the price point and location (nearto Bloor St and bustle), it's worth staying.

author: Thomas
comments: Good place, comfy bed, easy access to subway (and easy access to airport)!

author: Ethan
comments: Nice cozy apartment in a good location. Great communication with host and easy check in/check out. Thanks for letting us stay!

author: Morgan
comments: Fantastic apartment on the outskirts of Toronto. It's right next to a train station, so you have easy access to public transit, and Rolyn is on top of his game. He's extremely considerate of guests and responds quickly. Seriously, what a DVD collection too. The speakers are a really nice touch as well. 10/10 definitely recommend.

author: Liz
comments: Rolyn’s place was perfect for our quick stay in Toronto! We were able to walk to restaurants, bars, and shops. Would recommend!

author: Dakota
comments: Had a good time, great locale

author: Van
comments: This place was absolutely above value. It had everything you could think of. Check in was a breeze with detailed instructions. The home was very comfortable with a full kitchen for all of your cooking needs. The building gym and sauna made for a great way to start the morning. Everything was within walking distance from shopping to dining to entertainment, thanks to the host guide it made things super easy. Highly recommend anyone to take advantage of the stay if its available.

author: Fakari
comments: Imad’s condo was exactly as pictured! Upon arrival, Imad laid out very detailed instructions as to how to access and use different things throughout the condo and the building. He was extremely attentive and held a open line of communication for when I needed to reach him. The condo was very clean and central to location such as the CN tower, shopping centers, and several other locations. The condo was really cozy and made me feel right at home!

author: Chandler
comments: Imad’s place was perfect. Everything we wanted & more! Clean, cute and functional. I especially loved the location. Entrance is on a quite side street but still within walking distance to just about everything! Check-in and out were very easy. Imad was very prompt and helpful with the one question I had- would highly recommend and will be visiting again!

author: Douglas
comments: Clean, well equipped, great location.  The condo is well organized, has a nice entertainment system, comfortable bed, and a great view.  It is in a convenient location with many stores and restaurants within a few minutes walk.  The assigned parking in the basement is both convenient and warm if you visit in the winter with easy access to the elevator. Highly recommended.

author: Caroline
comments: Fantastic location, clean and comfortable  apartment and great gym!

author: Davy
comments: Great place with stunning view! Walking up with a cup of coffee and a view of Toronto everyday was a dream.

author: Lisa
comments: This condo was perfect for our trip to Toronto for the 2019 Film Festival.  Very convenient downtown location.

author: Daniel
comments:
Simply put, Amad's place is amazing. When I choose to stay somewhere, I'm very methodical in my choices that I make, so I did my research beforehand. All of that lead me to believe that I would not regret booking this place nearly 6 months in advance of my stay.

Overall, the place is just down right nice. No flairs, just everything you want/need. A comfortable and inviting 20th+ floor condo with a stunning view in the heart of a bustling and friendly neighborhood--what else could you ask for?  I can't recommend the spot enough. If you're willing to do a little walking and the weather is nice, this place is accessible to nearly the entire city. My girlfriend and I walked nearly 50 miles over 5 days because we we felt no need to not walk everywhere. 

Amad was great was well. He contacted me immediately after check in to make sure I did not have any trouble and answered the one question I did have during the stay right away. If something did go wrong, I am confident he would have handled it swiftly and without incident. 

I would not hesitate one second booking this place again.

author: Meilin (Linda)
comments:
Imad's place was located in a very convenient and central location, on the edge of downtown. Right downstairs is this supermarket called Rabba, a coffee shop called red rocket coffee, and Subway (sandwich place).
The view from the living room and the bedroom is great. Everything was very clean. Imad even provided extra towels which was very nice. The dishwasher however was broken just prior to our visit so that was really the only inconvenience we had. Even though we never met Imad, he was super responsive and helpful throughout the entire stay.

author: Samantha
comments: What a lovely home! We had a great time staying here. The location can't be beat; you are close to everything but out of the super touristy areas of downtown. Free parking made it so easy; though we left our car there and took public transit or lyft everywhere we went. The home is comfortable with plenty of space for two people and we loved the view! I highly recommend staying here.

author: Myrna
comments: It’s was good a couple things can be fix like the door to the balcony also the floor on the balcony..... other then that there no complains. Loved the view on the balcony.

author: Maurice
comments: Bachelor suite that was very clean and the view is beautiful. Located 5 minutes from Union Station with a view on the 40th floor. Much recommended stay.

author: Byron
comments: Great views! Will definitely stay again

author: Carter
comments: Great location! Great place to stay!

author: Chris
comments:
The TV was small, so it's better to just bring the laptop. Very clean, open kitchen space, ability to do laundry if need be. 

The elevators do take awhile to go up or down, so if you are in a rush. Allow 10 mins of extra time.

author: Brandon
comments: Perfect location, incredible view and balcony.

author: Debra
comments: When you stay here  you will have a sparkling clean location with breathtaking views in the heart of Toronto.  Highly recommend.

author: Robert
comments: Excellent location. Very easy to access. I really loved the view, it's amazing! I really recommend it to everyone who travels!

author: Fredrick
comments: I love it

author: Lindsay
comments: Beautiful view of the CN tower.  Great location downtown in the heart of toronto. Comfy bed. I only wish that the host would keep pots and pans stocked for guests. In my case, we went to heat up food in the oven and realized there was no pans, which I wouldve expected in the kitchen.

author: Mary
comments: Check-in was easy, view is as beautiful as the pictures and amzing at night.  The location is great for walking to all attractions.  Starbucks right downstairs for coffee. Apartment is clean and the bed is comfy.

author: Aaron
comments: Clean & beautiful location

author: Laura
comments:
We had a really great time!
The checkin worked great (we could even check in earlier since the cleaning lady was done earlier than expected) and the flat was really clean when we arrived. Highlight of the flat is definitely the view!! The location is perfect, it is right in the middle of the city. All in all we would definitely come again.

author: Julio
comments: Only stayed for one night but didn't have any issues. Check-in and check-out was easy to do. The host was quick to respond to messages. The view at night of the CN tower was amazing. The location was very convenient, several parking lots nearby and easy access to public transit. If I were to come visit Toronto again, this Airbnb would be worth a revisit.

author: Mariah
comments: So, my boyfriend wanted specifically a high rise apartment in Toronto for a weekend getaway. This popped up and thought it was perfect no matter where in Toronto. Well, we made reservations to Momofuku and plans to go to an event at the convention center and realized it was all maybe 10 minute walk or less from our place. It was perfect! The view laying in the bed at night, seeing the CN Tower, was incredible! Make sure you check in at the front with security, they will yell at you if you try to bypass them. Besides that, everything was great! A grocery store was literally next door so we grabbed breakfast stuff to make and there is a Starbucks next door as well. Also, we’re kind of spoiled with a memory foam mattress at home so the bed was a downgrade for us but it wasn’t terrible.

author: Aleigha
comments: Amazing view on this cute little apartment. Perfect for a short get away for 2

author: Charles
comments: Quaint & cozy very clean space with a fantastic view... We can clearly see why Slim is a superhost!!

author: Carlton
comments: Our stay here was great. Beautiful view and very close to everything we wanted to do. Any questions we have were answered immediately. I would definitely stay here again

author: Kelly
comments: The view was amazing as expected and check in was a breeze. Slim responded to all my questions in a timely manner and the place was cleaned up well. The only issue I had was that the shower curtain had a pink hue and black spots which I assumed was mold. Made the showering experience a bit uncomfortable, but other than that, everything was great.

author: Anita
comments: Really wonderful experience.

author: Brittany
comments: Management was amazing, very fast responses and very polite. Location was nice as well.

author: Teena
comments: This place was built to make money, not provide hospitality or make a cozy atmosphere. It was more sterile than clean. It was freezing in there and I do not recommend staying there in cold months. Although they turned up the heat (remotely) I think, it was still cold. We turned down our blanket and realized there was no top sheet only a fitted sheet, which is gross! How many people have slept with that comforter on them! Disgusting! There were no extra sheets or blankets. Our romantic night turned into sleeping fully clothed with hats on to stay warm! To top it off I complained that there were no washcloths and was told by them that each guest gets 1 towel! I just wanted to wash my makeup off! In the morning we were woken by housekeeping knocking on the door even though we were granted a late checkout. We tried to savor the night and take a hot shower before we left and SURPRISE no hot water!! Are you kidding me!!!! It was an absolute disaster and we will never stay there again! Plus they were not helpful at all with giving me close parking lots near them, I was told they couldn’t help me but when we got there, there was a parking lot right across the street! After paying $58 dollars to park for the night we would of been better getting a hotel!

author: Caiden
comments: Really great location and easy check in with a convenient city parking lot across the street. The room was perfect for two people.

author: Jyotika
comments: Clean, convenient, affordable. I was traveling alone and needed a safe, economical, non-fancy and clean place for myself. I stayed at their loft apartment the earlier night and that wasn’t available again, so I got this place. Both apartments are good.

author: Dylan
comments: Nice place to stay with easy access to downtown

author: Shannon
comments: Amazing location ! Super clean ! The only thing that was an issue was no tv and a lock on the thermostat so it was a little warm

author: Michael
comments: Good location downtown. Some homeless people walking around but not too bad. Building seems like all apartments are Airbnb. Mostly quiet except for 1 drunk person banging on door and screaming for about 10 min. Security guard there from 9 PM to 3 am. AC worked . Looks like apartment would be a little cold in the winter. Would definitelyrecommended this apartment

author: Zachary
comments: Very clean nice apartment within walking distance from the city center. Excellent at communicating. Great stay!

author: Gina
comments:
My only issues are that I wasn’t aware there was want a closet and the mattress was terrible. I didn’t expect the Ritz Carlton mattress but I did expect a mid level one that didn’t leave me in pain every morning. 
The place could use a fresh coat of paint as there are scrape marks throughout the apt. 
Management company is amazing. Lightning fast response time

author: Kevin
comments: For the price, you can’t find a better location. This place is steps from the Queen streetcar, and a few blocks from City Hall. It’s in kind of a weird building, and the floor it’s on makes it seem like this unit was built out of an office space, but once you’re inside your unit, it’s perfect. It was so very clean, had the basics, and was quiet. The parking is right out front on the street, and while you do have to pay, I didn’t for the entire time I was there and was not ticketed (do so at your own risk). I didn’t have to contact management at all, but they messaged me several times making sure I was OK, and I have no doubt that if I needed them, they’d be there.

author: Morgan
comments: Highly recommend!!

author: Ang
comments: Had a nice stay!

author: Makayla
comments: Very cute, quaint, and cozy! Close enough for a nice trip downtown and far enough to avoid intense traffic!

author: Kim
comments: Wonderful place. Lovely, clean and comfortable.

author: Iasia
comments: Guest house was the perfect amount of space, Lina and Paul were very kind and communicated very well!

author: Simanta
comments: Very comfy and private. Great location as well. And always had helpful Quick responses. Will definitely be back.

author: Erica
comments: Great little space if you are in the area for a few days! Walked to the go station and spent the day in Toronto. Perfect for 1-2 people

author: Tj
comments: Very very clean place, hosts are straight forward and extremely fast response time.

author: Brittney
comments: It was a great place! Lina and Paul were very kind and the studio was very clean!

author: Arin
comments: One of the best Airbnb stays we have ever had! Very helpful, professional hosts and the location has access to everything you could need. A genuinely memorable part of our trip!

author: Drew
comments: This was a nice location for people looking to be near bars and restaurant. We could get anywhere within 10 min walk or so. If you want to go to CN Tower, it might be most useful to get a car. There was no parking by the apartment, so be sure to find nice, affordable parking. It was very stressful when first arriving, because we couldn’t find anywhere to park. We will parked about two blocks away and had to tow our stuff to the room. Also, there is construction that was ongoing, which might of been minimizing the parking, but making many early mornings for light sleepers. My boyfriend and I loved Toronto! This is a nice place to rest after exciting days.

author: Andrea
comments: Easy to find, easy to get into. We were able to find a parking spot on the street out front and because we arrived after 9pm and left before 8am, the parking was free. Neighborhood is safe. The bath tub is HUGE! There is a great Thai place across from the camera shop. Best Thai I've ever had, plus, they made us a take out order 10 minutes before closing on a Sunday night.

author: David
comments: I found several items at the property to be sub-par. (1) Locking the thermost was not acceptable. (2) Not putting the towels in the bathroom was inconvenient. (3) The bathroom was clean but run-down with chipped tiles, missing shower door, adhoc tub access panel, etc.  (4) Lack of good clean drinking water options. (5) I really would have appreciated an iron for my dress shirt.

author: Eric
comments: Nice place to stay. Good location near downtown Toronto, everything is within walking distance. Lots of space and the bathroom is very spacious. Easy check-in and check-out process. Would recommend staying here.

author: Tj
comments: This place definitely serve its purpose. Booked this last minute and was satisfied for a quick one night stay. Very responsive management. One thing I would say is you can hear almost anything in the apartment building/hallways.

author: William
comments: Everything was just as expected.

author: Kathryn
comments: This was a nightmare.   The place itself was nice.  However, the host rented our floor to me (52 year old law professor, 21 year old daughter and 12 year old son) as well as to KIDS who had an all night party which involved many people running up and down the halls, smoking A LOT of pot (my twelve year old got contact high), blaring music, and screaming.  This went on from 7:30 p.m. until 3:00 a.m.  While the host's agents wrote back and stayed in touch, NO ONE showed up to shut down the party, no one called for or sent help, and when I asked for a reimbursement (just on principle) the host failed to respond.  We felt very unsafe.  After a few hours my plan was to leave and just pay for a hotel, however, it was TOO UNSAFE to leave our apartment.  When we left in the early morning, we could not exit the apartment because there was a 3 foot wide, 8 inch high pile of trash blocking our exit.   While my feeling WAS that a good host could unwittingly rent to a bad guest and thus I was willing to consider giving him the benefit of the doubt, the host proved himself to be untrustworthy when a) he failed to respond to my concerns the next day and failed to apologize or offer reimbursement (this wasn't about the money, it was the principle), and b) failed to send help when I said we felt unsafe.

author: Aj
comments: Great place, right downtown! Awesome price.

author: Joi
comments: PaperBox Mgnt were excellent hosts! The apartment was super cozy and clean and so close to all the downtown action. They were available to talk to on demand when I was having trouble getting in and provided very detailed information so there was no confusion. I can’t recommend this place enough!!

author: Erin
comments:
There are better options in this price range in town. 

This place was really really barebones and not well kept up. It wasn't a horrible experience, but it really was not good either:
-There was a piece of foam core covering a hole on the wall by the bathtub, held on by packing tape. 
-The spray nozzle/hose by the tub faucet leaked water everywhere, which I didn't learn about until a bunch of my stuff got soaked.
-The shower rack was completely rust covered.
-One of the blinds was broken and stuck all the way down.
-The apartment was unbearably hot, but there was a lockbox over the thermostat.
-I also couldn't open one of the windows b/c it was stuck closed.
-There was also an alarm going off by the front door that never stopped beeping for the day and a half I was there.

author: Scott
comments: This has probably been my favourite airbnb experience thus far. Couldn't find a single thing wrong with it. Thanks Erin and Carole for such a wonderful stay!

author: Terence
comments: I enjoyed my stay at Erin & Carole’s. Location was perfect. So many great places and restaurants nearby!

author: Caroline
comments: Amazing spot in downtown TO, super close to everything! Super easy check-in process, quiet, clean and comfortable. Loved it!

author: Selma
comments: It is a very nice place with a beautiful view   And great location. I will stay there again for sure.

author: John
comments: Great location for work or play in Toronto. Check in/out process was easy and hosts were available and responsive. I’ll definitely use again.

author: Dmitri
comments: This place is in a great location, right next to the CN Tower, with lots of restaurants and bars nearby. My favorite part were the amazing views from the balcony! The apartment itself was modern, clean, and very comfortable.

author: Bryson
comments: Great place to stay in a very nice building with a lovely view. Check-in and check-out couldn't have been any easier. The location is perfect, walking distance to almost everything and easy access to transit for everything else.

author: Barbara
comments: The condo was beautiful and had an outstanding view! It was exactly as the pictures portrayed It.  It was very clean and decorated in a really nice casual, modern style. Andreanne and Carol were a phone call or text away if we needed anything. We are looking forward to staying here again and recommend it highly to anyone who wants to experience a truly spectacular urban get-a-way!

author: Dani
comments: Best Place I've Ever Stayed At!! Planning on coming back!

author: Eric
comments:
AS ADVERTISED! 

Everything that Carole wrote in the description of her condo is spot on! Fantastic location with easy walks or a short cab/ uber ride to anywhere you'd like to go in Toronto. Carole's place was as clean as it gets and a much greater value than a hotel. She replied literally immediately to any and all outreach from the moment we booked to the morning we checked out, making our first airBnB experience a great one. We will definitely stay at Carole's the next time we come back to Toronto. Thank you Carole!

author: Abhishek
comments: Shannon is an amazing host. Kitchen is fully equipped and ready to be cooked. I travelled during this pandemic time worrying if the place will be clean or not but to my surprise everything was super clean, nice and hygienic. Right at the doorstep you will also have a sanitizer. Highly recommended.

author: Joseph
comments: The check in and out was super easy. I really enjoyed my stay.

author: John
comments: Really enjoyed our stay here! Clean and classic look and very comfortable. It’s a nice 30 walk to Ontario Place and not too busy. We loved the Himalayan restaurant the next street up.

author: Kevin
comments: Had an absolute pleasure of a stay, highly recommended!

author: Sarah
comments: Everything was great!!

author: Moa
comments: Everything met our needs, Shannon help us a lot in our check-out despite we took more time than needed. The place was sparkling clean, I definitely recommend this place if you are looking to stay like home.

author: Kennedy
comments: The stay was great! Very neat and clean. The location was good and Shannon was very fast at responding!

author: Kylie
comments: Wonderful airbnb! Very nice studio, good price for the location and amenities. Very cozy. There is ample street parking, never had an issue with that.

author: Rachael
comments: Great place to stay

author: Ant
comments: We had a great stay - Shannon made it all very smooth and easy!

author: Max
comments: Great place to stay

author: Ayano
comments: thank you!!

author: Danielle
comments:
This place was exactly as described and a great unit. It's nicely decorated with plenty of space to spread out (I had two people in my party and we had lots of space). It was nice having the bed and two pull out beds. There were lots of pillows as well. No extra blankets for the pull out couches though, though I had one in my car so we didn't bother asking for any extras.

The check in process was very easy with the lock box. We drove up from Rochester (NY) and there was plenty of street parking, though the price is a bit steep ($4 per hour). There's also a lot across from the property that you can pay to park in for ~$15 per day.

The location is okay. It wasn't immediately close to as many restaurants or other things to do as I was hoping, but it's close enough to other areas that you can walk or Uber to. There's also currently construction going on directly across from the property so there was a bit of noise with that.

The only complaint I have is that the wifi was not working upon our arrival at 4pm. I contacted PaperBox Management through the Airbnb app and while they responded quickly, they asked me to ask the renter in the unit on the third floor to reset the router. I tried, but there were no stairs leading up to the third floor that I could find (only outdoor steps to the main unit, which is not a rental I don't think), plus I wasn't comfortable bothering the other renter. I asked if they could contact them instead, and they did, but the guest was not arriving until around 7pm. I asked if someone from PaperBox could physically come out and reset the router in the meantime but they said it wasn't possible. It was finally fixed around 9pm when the other guest arrived, but I was surprised that there was only one router and it was in a different unit, and that someone couldn't come and reset it without the other renter.

Overall this was a good deal, but I probably would not re-book this unit in the future.

author: Chastiny
comments: Great area

author: Frass
comments: Good stay and very clean place

author: Eugene
comments: Good value for the location.

author: Ralph
comments: The apartment is a beautiful place to stay in downtown Toronto, central to many activities, food spots, etc. Would highly recommend!

author: Alex
comments: I had a great first time in Toronto! The place was just as it is in the pictures!

author: Todd
comments: Needed a quick place to stay in the city for a night. This Airbnb was a good location and a good value. Worked out well.

author: Brendan
comments: Very great space for an easy stay in Toronto! Will definitely use it again.

author: Huanran
comments: Comfortable stay in general. Will definitely come back next time.

author: Ashley
comments: Great space for a single traveler! Super nice host and convenient location!

author: Diane
comments: Very conveniently located, wonderful hosts, this is a bustling air bnb with lots of activity. But still, quiet, clean, peaceful, tasteful space with good heat and lovely washroom.

author: Mike
comments: Love the location with many places of interest easily walkable. A bonus was being able to meet the hosts--Elaine was kind enough to serve me dinner on my first night. My room was small, but well furnished and comfortable.  Outstanding value for location and amenities.

author: Greg
comments: This was my first air bnb stay in a room within a house.  The host were well organized, and the overall stay pleasant.  Good value versus a full service hotel.

author: Clarisse
comments: I had a great stay at Elaine and Greg’s place. Their place is minutes from the downtown scene.

author: Sean
comments: Elaine is great!

author: Zack
comments: Craig and Elaine have a REALLY cool home. Elaine is awesome, ask her about her adventures sailing. Even among several guests from around the world, I felt like I had my privacy. Small issues were taken care of promptly. Small touches like towels bundled with ribbon and a pitcher of water in each room are super thoughtful and give each room a homey touch.

author: Kayla
comments: As someone traveling solo, this was the perfect set-up for me. I looked forward to coming back a bit early to have amazing conversations with the hosts or other guests. Elaine and Greg have this routine down and are always welcoming and thoughtful! The location and value are wonderful and I would definitely book here again if I come back to Toronto!

author: Austin
comments: Excellent home base for touring the Toronto area!

author: Kaitlyn
comments: Great location

author: Maria
comments:
Major selling points of Amy’s unit: location and free parking. Parking is always a big concern for me in new places/big cities, and knowing that we had an assigned parking spot was majorly convenient. Although it was quite cold during our stay, as long as we were willing to bundle, everything was in a reasonable walking distance.

Other notes: I love to prepare home-cooked meals when traveling. Kitchen essentials were minimal (ex. No cutting knives for preparing food). Random miscellaneous items not very useful for everyday food prep.

Cleanliness issues with the unit/furniture. Spoke with Amy about this, who was extremely communicative and offered us a refund of our cleaning fee. 

Overall, an alright stay. Not the most comfortable of places, but if you’re just looking for a quick place to crash, this unit should be fine.

author: Char
comments: Perfect location ! Amy was super understanding and accommodating.

author: Grace
comments: Our stay here was as expected. Everything was clean, the space was roomy for 2 people and the location was wonderful especially if you like to walk and explore your area.

author: Angeberta
comments: If your familiar with New York Time Square,  then Amy’s places is the apple of Toronto. It’s literally next to everything, CN tower, 3D Toronto sign and the food was Aaaamaazinngg!  If your into dispensaries, there’s a few around the way and If your driving there’s parking space. There is a pool, sauna, gym etc.  And if you were looking for a hotel experience, Amy’s place is great choice.  I would definitely book again.  Ohh lastly, Amy is great host, her instructions were really clear and she be contacted at any time with comments or concerns.  I felt at home even when I wasn’t.

author: Gale
comments: Amy is a great host and communicator. I would stay at her property again.

author: Alexander
comments: Great apartment in a great area. Fast responses.

author: Syeda
comments: Its right in downtown and stylish

author: Tonya
comments: Had a great time! Amy’s place was very clean. Her instructions for check in was very detailed. Hope to visit again! Highly recommend.

author: Ryan
comments: Hardest part was the parking garage and that was as easy as it can get. Exceptional place and location.

author: Allison
comments:
Over all this condo was in a great location of the city and the parking being included was also a major plus. 
Parking:
The parking space was tight with the car next to us.  We both had to get in and out of the car from the passenger side door and unload the car before we parked in the spot.  
Key pick up:
So this was such a hassle.  Make sure you download the “KeyCafe” app (which I was not told about).  The key was not where I was told it would be and I was not informed about that.  I had to ask the pizza place for their WiFi password so I could call this property group and the worker did not seem very happy about that.  After I called, I was told where it was, we picked it up and all was good after that.  You only get one key and one key fob.  You need to return the key with your code to the pick up location when you depart. 
The condo:
The actual condo was pretty clean other than the bathroom because there was mold around the tub and a cabinet door was missing in the kitchen, but the bed was super comfy.  The bedroom is right above the garbage area outside which was loud in the morning.  
Amenities:
The pool, gym, and locker rooms are on the 22nd floor.  The key fob you get to park needs to be used to get into these rooms.  The fob is “gender specific” so if it is set to male, the females can not get into the pool or locker room and vice versa.
Clean up:
Make sure you follow the directions on how to clean the condo before you leave. I think it’s a little ridiculous we have to pay a cleaning fee when the guests do a handful of the work. 

The condo was decorated very nicely and in a great location.

author: Kaitlin
comments: Cute spot in an excellent location. Check-in instructions were a little confusing, but the host was quick to respond and instruct me to download the app. From there, checking in and parking was easy. Overall, great experience!

author: Yasmin
comments: Very nice place and close to everything.

author: Arya
comments: Excellent apartment unit at strategic location, we have wonderful stay. Has dedicated parking garage, 24/7 security, great location short distance to CN Tower, Roger Center, various groceries and coffee shops. Downtown and Chinatown within 15 mins walking distance.

author: Brian
comments: Excellent location in the heart of Toronto, amazing place that is super clean and comfortable to stay at.

author: Kenneth
comments: This apartment was in a great location, within walking distance from the conference we were attending. There was also a grocery store, liquor store, coffee shops, and restaurants nearby. They generously provided cooking amenities (cooking oil, cookware, salt and pepper). Had a Netflix account but no cable. Checking in was the only problem we encountered and it was an immensely stressful experience. We stay at Airbnbs often and this was out of the ordinary....I was emailed a link which told me the keys to the apartment were in a "keycafe" lock box at a pizza shop around the corner. I was told there would be free parking, however upon arrival there was no place to park and no directions as where to park, therefore reaching the "keycafe" lock box was not feasible. Upon calling the host to clarify, they informed me that the key was inside the unlocked apartment and that I needed to park in a "guest spot" (which were full) to go up to get the key. They informed me that the free parking spot was in the parking garage but I needed the key to access it. So, the only option was to leave my car in front of a "no parking" sign with one member of my party in the car. Upon entering the lobby, the security desk would not let me enter the apartment due to the fact that I had no key. I explained that I was staying at an AirBnb in the apartment complex, however they requested to speak with the host as they were unaware and unhappy with the situation. They reluctantly let me in but it was clear that they were upset that the host didn't inform them. I had to call to clarify the room number, key location, and parking spot number as this information was not provided.

author: Robert
comments: Very nice apartment, fantastic location. Apartment has a ton of key only access points for safety. Great place!

author: Patrick
comments: Overall very happy with the apartment, great location to walk anywhere

author: Rachel
comments: Great space.

author: Chetan
comments: Great spot near the city.

author: Dylan
comments: Amazing stay for Toronto! The place was so clean and at such a convenient location. And all for a great price. It was all great!

author: Timothy
comments: The room was spacious and comfortable. There were detailed instructions concerning arrival and departure procedures, and they responded to all my messages very quickly. I didn't end up getting one of their two available parking spaces, which wasn't such a big deal since I was able to find parking on a side street nearby, but I would have liked to have known beforehand that there was little chance of me getting a parking space with the amount of guests they had at the time. Otherwise, the place was wonderful, in a great location, and I had a very nice stay.

author: Yi
comments: Pretty nice place to stay for one night.

author: Lili
comments: This is a nice place to stay, super clean and good location.

author: Natasa
comments: Great location and clean space for the price!

author: Emily
comments:
Great for my 1-night trip!!
My room was clean, comfortably warm, the house was quiet and the location was AMAZING for convenience to my plans on Bloor. I suggest you bring your own pillow, and know, the onsite parking is tight.

author: Mark
comments: Very simple and easy check in experience. The common area and kitchen is perfect and extremely comfortable. Shared Bathrooms are lovely and not a problem to use at all. The bed and space was comfortable and lovely, only thing to note is there is no AC so visiting in the summer months requires the window to be left open. WiFi also doesn’t function extremely well in the bedroom but the common area is adequate.

author: Mason
comments: Nice place, good location, and great communication

author: Joseph
comments: Very easy checkin, great location! Room was perfectly small for just the two of us.

author: Azzam
comments: Great place if you are needing to crash. Location is wonderful for site seeing. Everything is nearby in walking distance. Parking is hit or miss as you can't reserve but there is a parking lot in walking distance with a flat nightly rate. Street parking depends on the day of the week but can work out to ones schedule if needed. Overall very nice and comfortable place to stay!

author: Aaron
comments: Awesome place! Looks just like the pictures and is very comfortable.

author: Zoe
comments: The space was really cute and convenient for one night in the city. The check-in and check-out was real simple. The only annoying thing was the parking situation, it’s not anyones fault but it is something to plan ahead for because the city parking is a pain in the butt. But we had an amazing time overrall :)

author: Israel
comments: The previous reviews that mentioned the paper thin walls were pretty accurate.  The room faces the road, so sometimes you’ll hear  vehicles and/or conversations from other guests.  Thankfully, when I stayed, the other guests were respectful and quiet during late night hours.  I brought ear plugs just in case because I realize that I could have coincidentally been sharing close quarters with rowdy guests.  The room was a bit cold in the winter since there was only one small heat vent for the fairly large room.  Other than that, the room was tidy, very clean and close to a huge selection of nice restaurants.

author: Amor
comments: Very nice host. Other guest in the house are quiet. Very close to lots of restaurants and it’s a very beautiful room

author: Samantha
comments: Great location in the middle of everything and close to public transportation. There was a soccer game at the school across the street that was loud and went on until about 11pm. This room was right on the street making for a night awake.  It was great to have wifi but I was unable to watch hulu or netflix because the wifi was poor. The owners did a magnificent job of communication and letting me know where to find clean linens for the bed.   Only being able to whisper in a room was a little ridiculous but the walls are so thin I could see why. This place was great for the night that I needed it as a solo traveler. If you are a hard sleeper this would be a great fit.

author: Brenda
comments: This is a very beautiful room inside a large house and there is plenty of privacy. It was very clean and easy to find. The only thing would warn future guests about it that it does face the road so you can hear every car that drives by all night long. It is also directly across from a track field with VERY bright lights that are on all night and illuminate the whole room (which made it a little hard for us to fall asleep).

author: Laura
comments: Very clean space, good for a short city stay. Thank you!

author: Anthony
comments: Good place for a good price. Easy check-in and very clean place. However, the walls are thin and the Wi-Fi is unreliable.

author: Marissa
comments:
I came to Toronto for a tattoo, just needed a place to sleep and found this cute room. It is almost an apartment/hostel set up. Really nice private bathroom, nice windows that lets you hear the city life & wake up to the sunlight. Only thing was that someone was partying under my room till late hours in the night and I could hear them through the vent. Wasn't really bothersome unless they yelled every now & then. The room is also right by the stairs so you can hear footsteps. These are not terrible things in my book, but just something to be aware of :) 

Thank you for your hospitality! I enjoyed my stay very much :)

author: Brian
comments:
Overall the experience staying in Toronto is positive. There is a bit downside on how when we arrive at the place,  the toilet bowl was clogged and we can't use it. We tried to call the management and they promised us to get it fixed by the next morning. It wasn't fixed until the following night. 

2nd is the use of the coin laundry. Guest can use the laundry between 5 PM - 10 AM, but the "housekeeping", kept his own personal laundry at the machine, therefore any of the guests can't use it. The dryer itself wasn't even emptied by the housekeeper, therefore, guest can't use it as well. 

3rd, on our 2nd night, the auto lock malfunctioned, and a guest frantically rings the bell and made some loud noises at the door, disturbing our sleep. It wasn't a pleasant experience having someone disturb our sleep since it happened at 12:00 midnight.

Nevertheless, the room is as expected. It was nice and clean, parking was easy.

author: Michelle
comments: Excellent stay in a fantastic location. I stayed two nights to attend an event at Scotia Bank Arena, which is so close that you look down on it from the apartment balcony! The building is safe and stylish, though the space is a bit small, but still plenty big for two people I think. Super quick responses from Oscar and the apartment is set up with all the basics you need. I would absolutely stay here again in the future!

author: Jase
comments: This apartment is great. Clean and has everything you need. It's close to all the fun stuff.

author: Vanna
comments: Very nice place to stay !  Perfect view !

author: Coen
comments: Perfect stay on a perfect location for a city trip to Toronto!

author: Trista
comments: I had a wonderful (Email hidden by Airbnb) munication was great, check-in was very easy and the location of the property was perfect for exploring downtown Toronto. I would definitely stay again.

author: David
comments: Me and my girlfriend stayed at Oscars place for 7 nights and let me tell you that the price for this location is hands down unbeatable. You are in between the Scotiabank Arena and CN tower. Walking distance to Union Station for anyone that doesn’t want to drive. The grocery store in the basement of the  high rise (Longo’s) has fantastic hot food during the day. You get a jaw dropping view from the balcony that I enjoyed every night of the city. As far as the apartment itself it was very clean and had a great setup and has all the dish ware and cookware you could ask for. I honestly could not have imagined a more perfect spot for anyone to stay at in the downtown Toronto area. I am so thankful that I found this spot and if this is a spot anyone is considering I have one thing to say...TAKE IT

author: Katie
comments: Oscar’s was the perfect place to stay for our time in Toronto. We were so close to everything and we could walk to most places. The views from the balcony were amazing too! (Hidden by Airbnb) worthy! The place was extremely clean, comfortable and check in was easy. There’s a grocery store right in the building with a Starbucks too and plenty of restaurants  nearby. Would stay here again next time I’m in Toronto.

author: Matthew
comments: Great host!!! Would definitely work with this host again in the future.

author: Greg
comments: Beautiful upscale location. Walking distance to everything.  Clean and safe.  Only thing I wish I would have known was about the NBA conference finals, as the streets directly outside the condo were literally filled and it took a long time to be able to get back home after our night out but it was totally situational.

author: Lisa
comments: Great location. Oscar was easy to deal with.

author: Anthony
comments: Space was clean, excellent location. Check-in was super easy. Only complaint is there were no sheets / blankets supplied for the roll out beds.

author: Aliyah
comments: nice place

author: Eric
comments: Thanks for the stay! Fine place for the price!

author: Teresa
comments: More spacious than expected. Paid parking right across the street. Very comfortable and convenient

author: Bryan
comments: Great Central location near subway lines and shopping!

author: Steven
comments: Good value for the price, you get what you pay for. Neighbourhood isn't great but just 2 blocks away is the mall.

author: Ikeasha
comments:
Pros: seamless check in, decent location
Cons: No washclothe- only one blanket and guest woke up cold. 
No personal touches to go above and beyond was disappointing especially for 160/night. I would not be back because of this.

author: Mathew
comments: Stayed here for the night and it's in the heart ofToronto, the location was amazing. The studio apartment was very cute and quite spacious! A lot of steep stairs but it is on the third floor. Another negative wads The house doesn't feel lived in, even leaving a pitcher of water in the fridge would have made me happier and i thought no tv was a little awkward but overall was a good place to stay at! Would stay again!

author: Jeff
comments: Easy instructions, clean place!

author: Grace
comments: The place was not as clean as depicted. The bathroom ceiling was coming off, many of the blinds were broken, and I found a hair in a bowl. The people below us were having a very loud party that night and construction woke us up in the morning.

author: Gabrielle
comments: Easy check-in, great value, beautiful bathroom, and nice large bedroom with a desk and fridge.

author: Ralph
comments: Nice place

author: Uren
comments:
I would not recommend staying here. There were way too many issues with this host:
1) note that the host has outsourced customer service to a 3rd party call center that handles all messages and calls. The call center was extremely unhelpful and often responded that they can’t get in touch with the real host or they will have to ask the question to the host and get back to me. It was extremely frustrating dealing with these middlemen. 
2) the room and bed were dirty when I checked in. When I messaged the “host” about it, they offered to tell me where the clean sheets were so I could replace them myself, and that the cleaners will clean the room the next morning - something that I found unacceptable. I ended up wasting a lot of time dealing with an Airbnb case manager to get a refund for that night. Side note: the cleaners did not clean the next day and came 2 days after I reported the issue.
3) on one of the nights of my stay, the Airbnb room next to mine was having a party - with loud music and making loud noises. I reported this to the host at 10pm (which was the start of their “quiet hours”). The host /call center were extremely unhelpful and didn’t do much to resolve this issue - ultimately they called the cops at 2am (4 hours after I had complained) to break the party up. They essentially disregarded all of their “quiet hours” rules that they have in this listing. 

Overall this was a very bad experience - this is a host that really doesn’t care about providing their guests a decent stay - and I would not recommend this host or this listing.

author: Phan
comments: Great value when you book and stay here.

author: Jane
comments: I enjoyed my stay in this room. The apartment was centrally located, clean, and check-in was a breeze. I would absolutely stay in it again, as it is a great value for the money.

author: John
comments: Room is clean. Location is in the heart of Toronto. A quick 10min walk from the train station to the location was perfect, especially since the  train station is the best way to the airport and Niagara Falls!

author: Marc
comments: It was good but expensive

author: Jen
comments: Great location with tons of things to do and explore very close! Had a great time catching amazing live music :)

author: Mike
comments: Great value! Right downtown, affordable parking lot. The building is clean and quiet, and there is a surprise jacuzzi tub!

author: James
comments: Good, safe location, easy walk to downtown, clean and bright space. It was pretty noisy at night.

author: N
comments: Great host, highly responsive, very good location.

author: Melissa
comments: This was a great place to stay, in the heart of Toronto close to all the things you want to see. The host keeps the apartment very clean with many helpful items throughout the house.

author: Lyla
comments: It is a nice place. Sparkling clean. Matt is a responsible person who always reply us immediately if we have any questions. View is amazing. The only thing is the parking. They don’t have a parking spot so you need to find parking yourself. There are some free parking on the street but only free from 9:00pm - 8:00am so you need to be careful. Paid parking is available at 30 per day. If you are here to tour Toronto and want to live in downtown, it is a great place. Walking distance to everywhere and convenient public transportation. If you are here for a while and have a car or is ok with public transportation, I recommend somewhere not in downtown but with parking in the building.

author: Emily
comments: This is a stylish, well-appointed apartment, with everything you need for a visit to Toronto. It's the 45th floor so the city views are unbeatable. The bed was especially comfortable and it was nice to come back after a long day of sightseeing and relax. We appreciated the welcome basket of goodies, and the location is convenient to the museums, metros, and interesting sights. Communication as fast and friendly. As some other guests have noted there are some reminder signs posted in the apartment but the instructions are really just common sense about respecting the space. Thanks for a lovely stay!

author: Malek
comments: The place was nice and clean!

author: Dylan
comments: Matt is a wonderful and responsive host. The place is amazingly located between 3 TTC stations and is walkable to much of Toronto's downtown.

author: Crystal
comments: The space is very modern and stylish. It compliments the spectacular view. The checkin process was very easy and it felt cozy in the space. We enjoyed our stay and the location was very close to trains and walkable to many restaurants and shops. It is a great place to stay if you are visiting Toronto. You feel like you are getting the ultimate city experience while staying here. Matt keeps the space very clean and organized. He is very detail oriented so the information is very straight forward and helpful. I would highly recommend staying here.

author: Jennifer
comments: Very nice listing centrally located I was able to walk everywhere. Easy check in and very clean.

author: Pablo
comments: I returned to Matt's apartment which now it became my home away from home in Toronto. the view at night is such a bonus- on top of everything else which is top notch!

author: Pablo
comments: The apartment is very  well located, and the view is stunning. It is very clean, and Matt's hospitability is visible from opening the door. A basket of snacks was provided which was very appreciated as I arrived late at night. Access and communication with him were top notch. I very much appreciated his labels providing instructions on how to operate inside. I had no chance to do a trial and error as most of the time we do things as we are used in our house. What we forget is that Airbnb is not a hotel, but someone else's home which is open to us and hence we should treat it as if it was ours. I love the Airbnb community and thanks Matt for opening the doors to me and trusted me.

author: Brooks
comments: We had a wonderful time staying here.  Unit was clean and easy to get in and out of.  It is a short walking distance to a lot of downtown things to do.  Great place to stay if you are going to the Meridian Theatre, it's only about a block straight down the road.  There is no parking included with the unit, but there is paid parking underneath.  It requires the key fob to get into a closed garage area, where you can pay to park.  Should hopefully not fill up as bad as the open public parking areas.  My F-150 just barely fit in the garage.  Highly recommended, thanks for a wonderful stay!

author: John
comments:
Brad’s place is in an excellent location. The CN Tower is a 10-15 min walk, the Hockey Hall of Fame is a 5 min walk and the St. Lawrence Market is a 10-15 min walk.
This Apt is very clean and Brad responded quickly to any questions we had.
We had a great stay with our family and looking forward to coming back.

author: Joseph
comments: Awesome downtown location. Simple check in and out. Clean. Modern. Would recommend.

author: Derek
comments: Brad’s place was exactly what I was looking for for my short stay in Toronto. Great location! Would stay again.

author: Alterra
comments: Very nice and affordable place to stay in downtown Toronto. Literally next to everything - it's all <20 min walk.

author: Bryant
comments: Brad’s place is Beautiful. It’s very convenient and near everything, if you can’t walk to where you have to go Lyft or Uber can definitely get you there under $10. He is very responsive and I would definitely stay at his place again.

author: Mary
comments: We loved the location of this Airbnb. It was so easy to get around especially having two toddlers with us. There is a grocery store nearby, and a ton of restaurants. Brad a wonderful host who responds very quickly. I would recommend staying here!

author: Allison
comments: Great location, central to all the tourist hotspots like the St Lawrence market, the ferry to Toronto island, Union Station and the CN tower. Super easy check in process and cheap parking within the building. Two bedrooms plus sleeper sofa was accommodated our group of 4. Would definitely stay here again!

author: Eva
comments: Brad was super responsive and he was really quick to resolve a parking issue. The location was super close to the St Lawrence market area and Union station. The second bedroom was smaller than expected and has no window.

author: Celene Beth
comments: Super close to all amenities downtown and checking in was flawless.

author: Emma
comments: Great stay with amazing views. Location is a bit far from the center city.

author: Maya
comments: Everything about the air bnb was so amazing, it was clean and trendy and beautiful. I would give everything a perfect rating except that there was not any visitor parking and had to pay the crazy city rates which is fine I guess, but would have been good to know prior. Also maybe the owners or previous tenants left a drawer full of condoms and line and a hot pink vibrator!! Pretty gross but it was the only thing really wrong with the place.

author: Rachel
comments: While the location of the condo is very nice, be forewarned that the place in and of itself is not. When we went to check in we were handed keys with no instructions on where the room was even located. There was a load of towels/sheets etc... in the washing machine upon arrival. The listing states AC is available, however it fails to mention that in the winter only heat is functioning. Because of this, there is no way to cool it off from whatever it is set at upon arrival which was much too hot for us. Opening the windows leads to no rest because of street noise and even when we did this it failed to cool off. Also, from 11:30pm onward a unit right across the hall had a dog that barked the rest of the night. I went and knocked on the door to get no answer, and then went to the lobby where the receptionists said there was nothing to do. So all in all we got no sleep that night. Upon calling and speaking with someone at Trace and mentioning these things, no sympathy or apology was given. We were told we should have known there wouldn’t be AC because the entire city of Toronto doesn’t have AC option in the winter. Well, that was a complete lie because the hotel we booked for the following night had AC and when we told her that we were told that they looked at us like we were crazy. All in all, 10/10 would not recommend unless you like a stuffy condo with a barking dog, and hosts that lie.

author: Guanmei
comments: Really great place in a really great area

author: Nate
comments: Good but slow responses and was very confusing

author: Davonte
comments: WiFi did not work and no one would respond to our messages.

author: Kendyl
comments: Beautiful place, right in the heart of Yorkville.  Tons of great stores, restaurants and bars right around the corner.  The wifi did not work for us, though which was unfortunate.  Would stay here again!

author: Avi
comments:
The apartment itself is fantastic. Gorgeous view of the city, ground coffee ready to brew, and a stylish modern comfortable interior. Great location as well near transit and the main library and museums. 
The building itself is kind of weird -- it seems to be all AirBNB rentals with multiple teenager parties happening in other rooms, and there was a dried up piece of dog poop in one of the building's common area hallways for two days of our stay until we personally cleaned it. The building staff did not seem to like the steady flow of AirBNB guests but were still kind and helpful.

author: Sachin
comments: Cleanliness is of concern

author: Wendy
comments: Be aware that the washer/dryer is one unit. Anything more than 4 articles of clothing will take multiple hours to finish. Wifi only worked for part of the time with no resolution. The whole building is on same central air. The building gets extremely warm in the winter and the only way to cool it off is to open the windows and turn off thermostat. Streets are really noisy at night so bring earplugs. Location was excellent. Easy to get to subway and most areas. Very central and in nice neighborhood. Building seems new and is very clean in common areas. Felt very safe and comfortable.

author: Brooke
comments: An amazing location! We were within walking distance of everything. The security was good and the staff were helpful.  Newman was great at communicating and answering our questions!

author: Jessica
comments: Excellent location. Walking distance to scotia bank center/union station. Small. Perfect for 1 or 2 people. 3 tops.

author: Colleen
comments: Newman’s building and condo is a super cool home base for a couple of days in Toronto. Clean, well equipped, and comfortable. Newman is a great communicator with clear instructions and spot on recommendations.

author: Ethan
comments: One of the best places I’ve ever stayed!

author: Zachary
comments: Great location downtown and very clean apartment. Couldn't recommend it more!

author: Dennis
comments: Newman was the perfect host.  He responded to all inquiries promptly and his check-in instructions were clear and easy.  The condo was quiet, the bed comfortable and the location perfect, close to Union Station, restaurants, sports and other entertainment venues. We would stay here again.

author: Dane
comments: Awesome

author: Steve
comments: Great place with all the main amenities you need, location is right in the heart of Toronto. Everything is extremely close and walking distance.

author: Ali
comments: Great location. Walking distance from the Rogers Center, Scotiabank Arena, TIFF festivities (what my friends and I attended for), and basically everything downtown. The space itself is well kept, but not particularly spacious. Comfortable for 2-3 people, a fourth would have to share the futon or sleep on the floor. But for the price, oh so fabulous!

author: Erica
comments: Excellent location in the heart of downtown, right next to CN tower.  Small space but clean and cozy, and walking distance for so many Toronto attractions. Would definitely stay there again!

author: Saad
comments: checkin was easy. good value for location

author: Nathaniel
comments: Thanks. Will be back!

author: Robert /Lucille
comments: This is comfortable and very ckean space close to Toronto's center. I recommend it to everybody.

author: Jennifer
comments: The apartment was clean, and relatively close to everything that we wanted to see and do while we were in Toronto

author: Jonathan
comments: r

author: Lawrence
comments: I loved the space

author: Jorge
comments: Great value, great location, easy check-in and very clean. Apartment was just as described.

author: Rafael
comments:
The place was very empty and low quality, including the walls.  Some of the furniture is old and is breaking down.  We were only given 2 towels and no hand towels in the bathroom.  The shower is separate from the toilet/sink, so you have to bring your towel around from the shower to the other room. When I asked for more towels, it was a hassle.  The lock to get the towels didn't work, and when I asked one the of the cleaning ladies for a couple of extra towels she asked me why I needed more towels.  One of the towels ripped when I was drying.  Looks like a company owns the whole building and they rent all the rooms on Airbnb. 

Location was good and walked almost everywhere.

author: Kristy
comments: Great location, walking distance to everything.

author: Revolution
comments:
(Hidden by Airbnb) maps dropped the pin a half  a block up at a building that looked similar but is actually an apartment for mentally ill and recovering addicts and they weren't the friendliest folks to accidentally approach. Not an great first impression.. 
The front door to this apartment is a hollow interior door that's flimsy with no deadbolt and a solid1" gap under the door. Theres no thermostat or way to control temperature and it was pretty cold in there. It's also extremely paper thin walls made it impossible not to hear every moment of the 3 hour pregame adventures of whichever tenants were the neighbors. 
This is on the second floor of the building and there was a raging party, on the sidewalk and next to the building, both under the bedroom window. Equipped with a DJ that brought his table and speakers and approx (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) people drinking, screaming, singing drunkenly loud. It was literally impossible to fall asleep. (This wasn't even on a raptor-game winning evening)
I ended up leaving early and spending additional money to get a hotel for the last night because it felt so unsafe in there and I needed sleep.

author: Janice
comments: Very clean apartment exactly as advertised. Easy check in. Well connected to city by walking or streetcar.

author: Andrew
comments: Overall good stay. Listing was a bit misleading, but we enjoyed our stay.

author: Terence
comments: Great place to stay! A little noisy due to the traffic but it’s Toronto.  Very clean and perfect for one person or a couple.

author: Ibrahim
comments: Clean and vibrant studio in a cool location

author: Fphasieth
comments: Perfect location ! Bed is super comfy.

author: Drew
comments: Good

author: Kimberley
comments: Nice clean property. Studio condo. Good location, parking is a little far

author: Conor
comments: Great place to stay!

author: Natalie
comments: Staying here was wonderful. It was about a 20 minute walk to the Roger's center and a half hour walk to Scotiabank arena.  There are plenty of restaurants around and picking up the keys was easy even though it was about 3 blocks away (about a 10 minute walk). There is parking available nearby, also about a 10 minute walk, that we played $13 to park there over night.  It was very clean and was perfect for an overnight stay.

author: Kumara Manoj
comments: I could have given a 5 star, but had some issues with the keycafe while checking in, but apart from that stay was great.

author: Nicole
comments:
Sean is amazing! 
The location is great and close to everything! I super recommend staying here!

author: Sergio
comments: Excellent host and great and clear comunicación. Place is near main touristic  attraction and safe area.

author: Lauren
comments: Sean’s place was fantastic. Highly recommend!!

author: Christina
comments: Sean’s place is very comfortable and cute. Sean was super accommodating and welcoming- definitely recommend his place!

author: Hattie
comments: Sean was a great host. Super friendly and accommodating. He was full of advice on things to do, places to see and eat. Many thoughtful touches in the apartment for travelers such as lotion, ear plugs, feminine products, etc! Location was in walking distance to Distillery district and the Saint Lawrence market!

author: Daniel
comments: Super cute bed room. The host answered all questions and messages very quickly. Would recommend!

author: David
comments: You simply wont find a better value in a more convenient locations. Sean is a great guy too!

author: Hannah
comments: Great location! Great communication! Always answered our questions quickly and thoroughly.  A very good local travel guide. So many resources! Sean was very friendly and accommodating when we requested to have an additional guest  stay for one of our nights and for no additional charge.
