author: Mohammad
comments: Great place, beautiful view.  Close to most attractions.

author: Luke
comments: Great place to stay. Great location.

author: Maritza
comments: Lan is a wonderful host, willing to answer all the questions in a short notice. It is very easy to communicate with Lan. The location is extremely convenient, walking distance to grocery shopping places, attractions, public transportation... The unit looks exactly as shown in the pictures, the view from the apartment is absolutely amazing! You can find all the amenities you need to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Lan is very thoughtful when it comes to decoration and providing guests with everything they might need. The building is beautiful and extremely organized. I recommend the place 100%

author: Marco
comments: Great view and so close to everything!!!!

author: Jiakun
comments: Best location which can see the beautiful view of CN tower and downtown. Very friendly and helpful host. Neat and stylish facilities and internal furnishings. Would recommend to all and will come living here definitely next time coming to Toronto

author: Robert
comments: The location was perfect for a stay in downtown Toronto, and the view was just as pictured. Lan was available to answer any questions we had, and even let us arrive early to leave our luggage and also store them for a while after checkout. I highly recommend!

author: Dashaun
comments: Great location. Clean and neat place. Would definitely recommend.

author: Aaliyah
comments: Loved it! Everything was amazing and she was friendly and informative!!

author: Morgan
comments: Great place to stay and great location.

author: William
comments: Great location and great host.

author: Kelly
comments: Clean, accessible location close to many attractions. Would visit again.

author: Gina
comments: We loved staying at Klodia’s. Location is great and the rooftop deck’s views were amazing!

author: Chris
comments: We loved the space and location.

author: Victoria
comments: Great place for the price!

author: John
comments: Great stay, close to errythang. Was cool to act like an urban settler for a change.

author: Jessie
comments: Klodia's place is perfect for a solo traveler or couple. Clean, comfortable, and quiet. She is a great host who clearly communicated and made sure I was well taken care of. Would certainly stay again when traveling for work in Toronto (which is often!) Thank you Klodia for a great stay!

author: Nicole
comments: Wonderful place to stay and such an easy location to get to everything Toronto has to offer! I would highly recommend.

author: Geoffrey
comments: Stylish, clean, amazing view! Would definitely book again.

author: Katia
comments: Perfect central location in one of Toronto’s liveliest areas! One of the cleanest and newest Airbnbs I’ve stayed in. Complimentary coffee was much appreciated. :) Very responsive.

author: Jenna
comments: Amazing host, amazing spot, seriously great value!!!

author: Heather
comments: My stay at Shauna's place was great! The location was perfect for walking to various areas of Toronto while also feeling like I was in a neighborhood rather than right in the middle of touristy areas. Plenty of great restaurants and coffee places nearby plus a grocery store if you'd rather cook at home. The apartment has everything you need to feel at home and was also super clean. Would stay again next time I'm in the city for sure!

author: Scott
comments: Great place in a fantastic location.  Very responsive host.

author: Shahira
comments: This place is awesome! Close to everything. The spot is located near tons of local bars and restaurants. Convenient to everything in Downtown Toronto. The host was quick to respond to all my questions. Easy check in and out; I would stay again.

author: Earl
comments: Excellent place to stay when visiting Toronto. Very nice area with lots of restaurants nearby.

author: Klei
comments:
We stayed here for a few days at the end of September and couldn't have been happier.  Our flight was late getting in from the West Coast and Shauna was great keeping in contact to make sure she was available when we finally were finally able to make it to the property.

The property itself was perfect for my wife and I, as we were only staying for a short time.  It was located next to any number of great places to eat, and it was extremely easy to get around town from.

I would definitely recommend Shauna's place to anyone coming to Toronto.  Thanks again Shauna!!

author: Priscilla
comments: Shauna's place is a fabulous location! Walking distance to amazing bars, restaurants, and clubs.  In addition, the check in was very easy and the location was easy to find. The place was sparkling clean with every amenity we needed. Loved my stay here and would definitely return.  Great value and great location.

author: Isabel
comments: Very quick responses and very kind hosts

author: Dalton
comments: The condo was clean, well kept, and nice. Location is unbeatable if you’re in town for a convention or trade show!

author: Paola
comments: Great place, very clean, close to everything. There was even bottle water, cookies, tea and coffee to enjoy.  Sheena got back to me very quickly if I sent a message. I highly recommend it!

author: Rachael
comments: Great place to stay. Would definitely come back again :) Awesome location and nice building. Great communication and very convenient for a short stay for tourists.

author: Michael
comments: Great place!  Awesome communication!  A nice place to stay!!

author: Denis
comments: Place has terrific access, especially if you're taking the train in from Union Station.  Instructions for check-in were clear and easy and Jennifer did a great job of communicating in a timely manner. I would highly recommend this place!

author: Jennifer
comments: So cute for 2 people traveling to Toronto. We went to a concert at Scotiabank Arena and it took less than 2 minutes to walk there! All kinds of grocery stores are nearby and the patio has a partial view of the lake. I would stay again!

author: Carol
comments: If you need only a double bed, this unit is fine.  If you need two separate beds, this unit is inappropriate.  Also, entering  into the unit without being stopped and questioned by security may be a problem.  I don’t believe I was ever been in touch with the “owner” Jennifer.  It seems the real owner of the unit was another fellow.  Each time I called, I got different person.  It seems that the unit is managed by a company.  The people who worked for the company were very helpful but one needed to call during working hours.

author: Devin
comments: The apartment was perfect for a short trip and location was just amazing for what we wanted to do while in Toronto. Would absolutely stay there again if in Toronto.

author: Claudine
comments: Jennifer's apartment was great! My colleague and I were attending a conference at the MTCC, so the location was perfect. We needed a room to stay for one more night, and Jennifer responded super quickly and got us set up in her place.

author: Sarah
comments: Place was very clean, location is great to walk around, vinny communicated directions and checkin/check out instructions well.

author: Jillian
comments: Beautiful with a great location.

author: Brittany
comments: Wonderful place to stay !!! Vinnys place was sooo comfortable.

author: Nikki
comments: It was pleasure staying at Vinny’s. He was helpful and communicative and his place was lovely. Highly recommend!

author: Scott
comments: Vinny's space was a great location for a great price. Clean, comfortable, and a very smooth, simple check in process. We appreciated the snacks left out for us and the washer/dryer was also handy towards the end of our trip. Overall a great experience! Perfect location for convention center travel.

author: Annie
comments: The place is great! It is quiet, gorgeous, and super affordable. I loved the spot, and would have stayed longer if I could! Def. coming back!!!

author: Mary
comments: Fab location, stylish space, good communication from the host. Recommend!

author: Janet-Jon
comments: When you enter or exit the tall building that houses this apartment, look up! You will be in the immediate shadow of the CN Tower - it is incredibly close! We walked (with luggage) the five or six blocks from/to the Union train station for convenient airport access (UP Express), which normally would be easy without the heavy luggage, or tons of people out on the sidewalks, but with heavy luggage and Friday foot traffic it felt like a much longer walk. We survived and the apartment was worth it! The apartment is super clean, tastefully decorated and comfortably furnished; and it was very quiet and secure when we visited. We would definitely choose to stay there again.

author: Aaron
comments: Vinny was a great host. There was 1 small issue and he was able to immediately sent maintenance to help out. Overall a great place.

author: Heather
comments: What a great location. We had a wonderful time. I surprised my husband with a trip to Toronto to see a concert and we really loved the city. The place was close to everything and we got to tour the city. We can't wait to come back.

author: Dani
comments: Great place, clean and right in front of the CN Tower. Would stay here again.

author: Revathi
comments: Great place! Amazing view of the CN Tower. Comfy couches and bed!

author: Allana
comments: Great view

author: Nicholas
comments: Awesome location, great views!

author: David
comments: Great view and location

author: Daniel
comments: Incredible view. As soon as you walk into the room you get smacked by the cn tower. Really outstanding.

author: Joey
comments: we love u

author: Noa
comments: This apartment is an amazing find for the price. We couldn’t believe how affordable it was and what we got for our money. The views are amazing and the apartment building has a really nice gym and a pool. There are grocery stores really close by and there are utensils and basic cook ware that guests can use if you want to save some money instead of eating out. The instruction on how to check in are really clear and the WiFi worked well and we found the bed to be extremely comfortable. This apartment has all the necessities such as an iron, a coffee machine, and a washer and dryer in unit. Highly reccomend this place!

author: Cristina
comments:
This place has an epic view! This alone made it worth it for me but a
the apartment was also comfortable and cozy. It’s well taken care of and the kitchen is functional and has enough supplies to cook decent meals with. I’d stay again.

author: Okeema
comments: Great location. Around almost everything. Very clean apartment! The view in the night is absolutely amazingggggggg. Would definitely stay here again.

author: Musab
comments: Dale is a great host! The location is AMAZING. The view from the balcony is probably my favorite thing about staying here - PERFECT! The apartment is as you see in the pictures - it’s good. However, a few things to mention. The apt needs to be fixed/ remodeled a bit more - furniture is old and things need to be fixed like light bulbs, taps, lamps, etc - but it’s EXTREMELY comfy and cozy. Also keep in mind Airbnb is NOT allowed in this building so you kinda have to “lay low” from concierge. Also The windows are NOT sound proof which means there is SIGNIFICANT traffic noise that will affect your sleeping if you’re a light sleeper (right on the highway) - which is why I didn’t give this place a 5 star. Thank you Dale for being an amazing host. I would recommend this place to friends.

author: Neil
comments: Nice apartment , convenient location, would recommend!

author: Ricardo
comments: Expect privacy and elegance...thanks guys - you made our Christmas special!

author: Sanjana
comments: Good value for money and centrally located with access to the path. The only downside is that the elevator wait at peak times are extremely long.

author: Adam
comments: Dale is a nice host and this spot is in the perfect location for everything that you would need our want to do in Toronto.

author: Daniel
comments: Great place with a nice view in a convenient location. Dale was very prompt with any questions I had. Overall, easy pleasant stay in Toronto!

author: Troy
comments: Dale is a great host and the apartment comes exactly as advertised. Dale gives very detailed and helpful instructions for checking in to the apartment. He was also helpful in providing tips for parking. The apartment itself is clean, spacious, and incredibly convenient from a location standpoint. Would definitely stay here again when returning to Toronto.

author: Josiah
comments: This place was fantastic! It was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The best part of it was the view, location, and price! It was right in the heart of Toronto. I would highly recommend this place for everybody!

author: Kevin
comments: Great location, kind of shocking instructions to find but everything worked out find. Will for sure use again.

author: Louis
comments: The location was amazing. We were there to watch the Raptors win the finals and this was the place to be! I would highly recommend this location to anyone visiting Toronto for the first time. The hosts were also very quick in their responses.

author: Emani
comments: Zain was absolutely amazing! He responded quickly, gave great traveling tips for navigating the city, and provided a warm, comfy, and clean space to stay. The place was beautifully decorated and the view was amazing. I would love to be hosted by him again and would recommend his home to all. Thank you!

author: Seamus
comments: The apartment has incredible views. It was clean, conveniently located and the building felt new. The value of the apartment is fantastic. I didn't love waiting for the elevator to come. It also felt like the building wasn't built very well and I felt a bit unsafe taking the elevators (probably a me problem). Overall it was great for a few nights.

author: Marissa
comments: This place has the best view of the city! Very cozy, perfect for 2. And the location is perfect. Just a quick walk to Union Station, so you can hop on the easy-to-use TTC (if you’re driving, use the 25 York garage, they have the best 24-hour rate). Most major attractions are within walking distance: the CN Tower, Ripley’s Aquarium, Rogers Centre, and Scotiabank Arena. If this listing is available, you should definitely take it, you won’t find a better spot!

author: Mark
comments: View is amazing, place was very clean, central location. Everything was as advertised.

author: Nicole
comments: The views and location were amazing! The apartment was perfect for my stay and I will definitely be visiting again.

author: Angel
comments: They apartment was amazing & very clean. And the view was just beautiful! I would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Toronto & would stay here again.

author: Sarah
comments: Amazing location with even better views! Just what you’d need for a weekend getaway. Zain was very responsive and the place was just what we expected! Would definitely stay here again if I found myself back in Toronto.

author: Jason
comments: The view is amazing. The hosts are extremely nice and answer quickly to any/all questions you may have

author: Iou-Ren
comments: Amazing view and great location!

author: Kenneth
comments: Great location and super view.

author: Derrick
comments: The stay was Greattttt. Heated bathroom floor. Privacy (which is a big deal for me). Great safe location and neighborhood. Close to public transportation. The Hosts were both great. Definitely would stay again!

author: Erica
comments: Maureen is very communicative and helpful. I definitely would stay with her again.

author: Janie
comments: Maureen is a wonderful host! Check out High Park when you stay here

author: Baba
comments: Maureen and Harvey were very hospitable. Getting to the old Toronto downtown area and to the airport from their place was as convenient as can be. Highly recommend.

author: Melissa
comments: We enjoyed our stay at Maureen’s place. It was very clean, easy to check-in, easy to find parking, etc. We chose to walk everywhere and it was a little far for that, but we easily could’ve taken public transportation. Overall, I would recommend staying when in Toronto!

author: Andi
comments: Maureen was great! She was very quick to respond to our messages. And very flexible with check-in. We wanted to park our car on the street and take public transit downtown and didn't know how late we would be back. Maureen let us drop our stuff off early before check-in and grab keys so we could stay out as late as we wanted without worrying about having to get back and check in.

author: Brendan
comments: Great stay

author: Olivia
comments: Such a great place!  An amazing bathroom, a simple breakfast available, fridge, cutlery, comfy bed, the works!  A quick subway ride to downtown as well.  Maureen made check in/out easy and we had a great time. 100% recommend!

author: Jon
comments:
Great place to stay, walking distance to lots of neat restaurants and stores. The shower is an unexpected treat--really strong water pressure and very new. And of course, the heated bathroom floor can't be beat. Very nice (firm) bed. The breakfast, coffee and tea were a very nice touch. 

Taller travelers will need to duck while walking around the unit, but that's a small price to pay for a great little spot from which to explore Toronto!

author: Zoe
comments: Maureen's charming place was the perfect place to stay while we were passing through Toronto. It was charming and comfortable, check in was very easy, and Maureen kindly printed put our parking permit for us. Maureen's place is within walking distance of plenty of great restaraunts and coffee shops, and we had a great meal thanks to her helpful reccomendations!

author: Michael
comments: Cute little studio with a lovely sauna.

author: Todd
comments: I've been staying at Shelley's place for years. It's always a wonderful experience.

author: Pauline
comments: Wonderful location and in Toronto! So close to everything. Perfect for a quick stay in town!

author: Samantha
comments: A great space and even better location! 10-15 minute walk to a few different areas of awesome restaurants and shops. The sauna was amazing. It's a small space, but no issue for two people with the fold out bed. Recommend!

author: Stephen
comments: Great stay. Highly recommend. Pullout bed was very comfortable and the location was accessible for around the city.

author: Carolyn
comments: This was our first trip to Toronto and it was the perfect place for a young couple on a budget! This was a great location, with a quick walk to the stop for the bus and train (which I definitely recommend using, it was difficult driving downtown). There's also some cool bars and cute breakfast places in walking distance as well. The place itself was very clean and they definitely did a great job making the most of the space. The only thing was that the pullout bed wasn't super comfortable, however a slightly sore back was well worth the price and location.

author: Nina
comments: Shelley’s place was perfect for our quick weekend away. It was easy to access and a short walk to bars and restaurants. Shelley was quick to respond and very hospitable. We would definitely book again!

author: Marta
comments:
Location was perfect! Two blocks from Queen St on one side, two blocks from Dundas on the other. Quiet neighborhood feel but next to amazing bars, restaurants and shops.

We had a blast and took full advantage of a sauna room after our mornings or evenings out. The bed was incredibly comfortable and we loved the private feel.

author: Jessica
comments: The location is great. The shower situation is not fantastic.

author: Hewad
comments: Paul and Shelleys space was great and accurately described. The sauna was a great unique touch

author: Chris
comments:
This place is about 45 minutes of TLC away from being a perfect Airbnb listing. 

Great space, great patios, great location, great kitchen, great amenities*

*There were a host of super minor issues I would not even bother to mention on their own, but worth mentioning in their totality: bathtub drain was broken, knives in the kitchen were dull, no dishwasher detergent (host offered to reimburse), internet was too slow to support two people working remotely, no screen door in the bigger patio, cracked mirror on the wall...

I would still recommend this Airbnb, and the above issues were again super minor and super easy to address - just notable for the totality of it.

author: Nicole
comments: In a great location!!

author: Mariah
comments: The place was beautiful inside and out! Everything was easy to get to and there was so much to do around! Highly recommend!

author: Jeff
comments: Francesco's place is stylish, clean and located in great location. Plenty of restaurants and shops within walking distance. I highly recommend it!

author: Lindsay
comments: Francesco’s place is stylish, clean, and very close to many great restaurants and cafes. Walking distance to most places we needed to go and paid parking on site!

author: Manisse
comments: Apartment is clean and neat and smelled great! Bed was comfortable with good support after multiple nights. Bathroom was extremely clean and had great amenities with a huge tub and separate shower. Location was close to several restaurants and bars. View was slightly misleading as the apartment is located on the second floor. Building felt safe and easy to navigate after you walk around a bit.

author: Michael
comments: Great stay! The apartment building is nice, quiet, and has a doorman. The unit is a one bedroom with a full kitchen, bathroom, and w/d. Everything was clean and worked! The space is stylish. The location is great - also easy to walk around from there. Overall good value

author: Hannah
comments: This place is very clean and stylish! Also in a prime location for shops and nightlife. I would stay here again!

author: Chujian
comments: Good position and clean environment

author: Anthony
comments: The location was great.

author: David & Kova
comments: The apt. was perfect for my 3 day work trip! Clean, easy to self access and very perfect location to just about anything. Highly recommended and will definitely look to stay again should I need to travel for work again. Thank you!

author: Robert
comments:
If the hot water is even slightly meh, it's noticable. Rarely is it noticable for being great, and yet, Isaac's place was just that.

Also great location in the heart of things you'd want to do.

author: Alexa
comments: Isaac's space is clean and simple. Close to all markets, food, restaurants. Public transportation is right outside your door. Full kitchen if you wanted to purchase/ cook food from the grocery store up the block! Super close to Spadina and Queen for shopping and food! I will definitely go back for future trips.

author: April
comments: it’s good for a short trip or longer. it’s good for 2 people since it’s a small studio. it’s nice and very comfortable. will come back for this place again! thanks!

author: Ben
comments: Perfect flat for a business trip. Great location, clean, nice amenities, and easy check in. Would  stay there again.

author: Chandler
comments: Fantastic place, located centrally in Toronto

author: Heaven-Lee
comments:
Beautiful space, exactly what you need for this trip!!

The place is exceptionally clean and in a safe neighborhood. Most importantly, you are near all of the major streets for attractions. There is never a dull moment as you are close to entertainment, transportation, and shops.

Perfect space if you are from out of town and looking for a place to stay.

author: Mitchell
comments: Place was great! Bed was very comfortable and location couldn't have been more ideal.

author: Beth
comments:
Had a wonderful stay here.
The location was great. Very clean and modern.

author: Claudia
comments: If you're looking to stay downtown in a small studio with no parking, this is it. Very basic, nothing to rave about. Clean and comfortable. A few things I didn't care for is: one-  we had to pay $90 for parking for two nights across the street in a lot even though we requested parking two months ahead of time. Secondly, we were not informed we had to sign in w the security guard on arrival. He was rude and condescending towards us. All in all just OK.

author: Brett
comments: We planned a quick overnight getaway in Toronto and Jimmy's place was a great fit.  It was clean, accurately listed, and communication was excellent.  There were clearly laid out instructions for check-in which was a breeze.  If you're looking for a straightforward place to crash and not break the bank, I would definitely recommend Jimmy's place.  We will look to stay here again when we're back in town!

author: Jonathan
comments: Jimmy’s place was just what I needed. It was affordable, yet I didn’t feel cramped. Access to public transportation was very close, so you never felt too far away from downtown. Thanks, Jimmy!

author: Zachary
comments: Great stay! Far walks to places but was manageable. Great restaurants near by!!!

author: Kevin
comments: Cozy and very clean! Communication with check in was great!

author: Pascal
comments: Very clean place and peaceful.

author: Aubrey
comments: Great value and great location with close proximity to many Toronto attractions. Very quick responses from host and we would definitely stay again!

author: Kyle
comments: This airbnb was perfect for what I needed it for.... clean with great presentation, the check in directions  were easy to follow and the parking across the street was very affordable compared to other parking around the city.

author: Gabby
comments: Shengs place is just as pictured. Super clean and perfect for a couple days stay. Check in was so easy and the parking lot was directly across the street! Would highly recommend

author: Danielle
comments: Great location with easy, affordable parking across the street. Everything was clean and it was exactly what we needed! Thanks.

author: Lindsay
comments:
This bedroom is fine if you are only staying for a couple of hours, and if you are not claustrophobic!!! The room is only 4 walls with no window leading to the outdoors. The window that you see in the the picture leads into the basement hallway. Unsafe if there were to be a fire, you would be trapped in the room.  You have no concept of time in this apartment as you are in the basement again with no window access. 

The place was very clean and Sheng communicated the instructions to the bedroom well.

author: Jason
comments: Very accomodating

author: Joyce
comments:
Elaine & Greg, were truly amazing! My stay was a lot better than i had anticipated. Mainly because I’ve never gotten a shared Airbnb with strangers before. The experience was very convenient and the ladies who came in and out of the room i shared were all super nice.

I was a bit worried with the whole parking thing, as i had drove my car to Toronto. However, Elaine has great information regarding the cheap private parking lot. Which was super hassle free once parked. When i had a hard time finding it, she was very patient with directing me on the phone while at work too.

As far as the noise, I expected it to get a bit noisy due to the fact that multiple people live/sleep in the space. All with different sleep / wake times. The noise isn’t obnoxious though, so it wasn’t an issue for me. Falling asleep at night was really easy and waking up as an early riser was also noise free. I hardly noticed there were two other people in my space. 

Anyways, AMAZING place to stay. It’s super cheap and worth it! This location helped me spend my money on more amazing things for the few days I was there, instead of spending hundreds on a hotel/Airbnb.

author: Becky
comments: This is a wonderful hostel-like home that was clean and beautiful. Elaine was a wonderful host.

author: Jessica
comments: Awesome people. Elaine was very nice and thoughtful.

author: Lenny
comments: If you need to crash for a few hours, this is the right place. Ear plugs recommended.

author: Omaya
comments: Elaine and Greg have a very nice place. It is clean and easy to get in and out. I like the shared room because I am a solo traveler and it’s nice to get to know new people.

author: Helen
comments: Elaine & Greg are friendly and welcoming hosts. They are helpful and kind. While staying there you are likely to meet other travelers like yourself, so there is always someone to talk to or get to know. It is in a good location in relation to attractions around the city and is close to public transit routes. If I visit Toronto again, I’ll be looking to stay with them!

author: Delbert
comments:
Greg and Elaine are very friendly and make you feel at home right away. The place was filled with travelers while I was there, a nice rotation of people from all over the world. The room was semi-private in that the beds are all adorned with curtains, and you can always change in the bathroom, which was gorgeous, btw. It even has a sunken tub with jets! 

The location is great--almost anything you want to see downtown is within walking distance, and there are hundreds of Ubers in the area in case your destination is too far for walking. I used Uber twice and didn't wait more than three minutes either time.

There is plenty of room to keep your things, and Elaine puts a little pitcher of water on the nightstand for you along with some little candies and some nicely-wrapped towels to use. I had a wonderful stay!

author: Randy
comments: Good flow of interesting guests and common area very conducive for meeting & conversing.

author: Zack
comments: Very good place if you are on a budget, everything is available and sufficient.

author: Hannah
comments: This place is excellent! Very clean and the view is amazing! Would definitely stay here again.

author: Sarah Rose
comments: This tiny apartment is an oasis an the sky. It’s central location makes it close to many fabulous restaurants, bars, and sites in the area. The natural light is outstanding and the overall cleanliness is pristine. The gym in the building makes it such a treat—esp because the machines are high quality and the room has big glass windows. If you have an opportunity to visit this part of Toronto, Vivian & Wei’s Place will not disappoint.

author: Kristen
comments: The view. It was unbelievable. What a cool, unique place to stay in such a great city. We walked everywhere!!

author: Stephen
comments: Excellent location and good value for money. We had a wonderful time, but with a few exceptions that would keep us from coming back. The fire alarm was being tested for hours during the day, and multiple false alarms occurred in the middle of the night (and signage in the apartment indicated this might be a frequent occurrence). The place was a good enough size for two people for a few days, and the view was exactly as incredible as we expected, but the rest of the experience and the lack of small touches didn’t measure up to the AirBnb Plus moniker.

author: Natalie
comments: We LOVED this place! It had everything we needed! We had an amazing time and couldn’t get over the view. Woke up to a beautiful sunrise! We only stayed one night but we WISH we could’ve stayed longer! Thanks so much!!

author: Vanessa
comments: The host were lovely and easy to reach at all times. The air b&b was in a nice location with a lovely view but IT WAS SMALL very small. I wouldn’t recommend this place for more than one person, YES one even if it’s your significant other the place is too small. It’s honestly smaller than a standard hotel room

author: Rebecca
comments: Excellent communication with the hosts, who were also  very accomodating. Location is perfect. A quiet retreat which allows one to thoroughly enjoy all the city has to offer.

author: Steven
comments: Great location with gym!

author: Mackenzie
comments: This condo is in the perfect spot. Amazing view of the city and within walking distance to anything you want do. Great space for 2 people for a long weekend... we enjoyed our stay so much! Definitely would book another trip in this spot.

author: Tom
comments: Beautiful view with a simple but very effective layout. Had everything we needed and the hosts were extremely easy to communicate with! Very clean and comfortable.  Recommend for any 1-2 person stay.

author: Mehrdad
comments: Good communications. Nice apartment. Easy check in. Great location. Would stay here again on my next visit.

author: Katherine
comments: Robby's place is located in a really cool area of Toronto with a lot happening. Really easy access to the apartment and very clean. We enjoyed the stay!

author: Hailey
comments: Great stay in an amazing location!

author: Sadaf
comments: It is a great Tiny place and very clean.

author: Lynda
comments:
Robby was very helpful and quick to respond to all of our communications with him. His place is fresh and modern and in a great location, but we found that we wanted to like it more than we did. For us, it had one major problem and several little ones. The big problem was the bed itself: it was extremely hard (not firm) and so uncomfortable that my friend and I were both waking up frequently in the night with aching backs and hip pain, taking ibuprofen to try to help. It felt like we were camping on the ground with just a thin sleeping pad. Not having a good night's sleep made it tough to be excited about seeing the sights in Toronto.

The little inconveniences included no in-suite coffee, we couldn't find hand towels, and we couldn't get anything on the TV. This was our first experience where you get the whole place (as opposed to a suite in someone's house) and it may be typical for this type of rental, but we really missed  these common hotel amenities. The place was top clean, but not super clean. In the bathroom, for example, the sink and toilet bowl were both clean enough, but the baseboards, base of the toilet, outlets - really any other surface - was covered with a pretty good layer of dust.

There were also some inconveniences outside of the host's control that are just good to be aware of. Parking costs about $25 a day and you have to go renew the parking in the morning and at night. Access to parking required going outside the building and down through a horribly disgusting and convoluted stairwell. Also, the fire alarm went off in the middle of the night and we had no idea what it was.  We texted Robby right away and he was great to get back to us quickly. Talking to another tenant the next day, we learned that this is a frequent occurrence, so future guests might just want to know of the possibility.

author: Alexander
comments: Excellent place and location, great building. The only thing not available is a balcony which would’ve taken this place over the top. Sammy was great with communication and you’re in the heart of a lot of areas. Enjoyed and would return.

author: Cat
comments: Sammy’s place was awesome! Very clean and cozy. Everything was so close too! Was able to walk everywhere. Had a bit of a problem with the TV/internet but it wasn’t a big deal since we were out most of the day/night! I would definitely stay here again!

author: Bianca
comments: Great location, Sammy was very responsive and helpful. But for the price, we expected more amenities such as coffee and bottled water. If Maybe could have been a little cleaner. If not for that we’d give 5 stars for sure. If you’re just looking for a place to sleep while you explore Toronto this place is ideal.

author: Rachel
comments: This place is fantastic. 5 stars.  We needed to use the kitchen a lot and there was a great fridge, oven, stove, pots and pans, etc., but no microwave and no big knife. But, all the places I've been have lacked something I want in the kitchen, and this place is so great in every other way, I would still rebook in a heartbeat.

author: Alec
comments: Sammy’s place is great! She is very nice, helpful, and responsive. We found it to be a great location, walking distance from pretty much all of the major sites, and we thought Toronto was a great walking city when the weather is nice. It was very clean and comfortable. Definitely recommend for any couple looking to explore Toronto!

author: William
comments: This little apartment is in the perfect location for exploring Toronto. The space itself it small and sparse with plenty of natural light. Missing some small touches of home such as no sink in the washroom but overall had a great stay.

author: Kenta
comments: Convenient location!

author: Mitchell
comments: The door to the room has a gap and the deadbolt had room to move in its socket.  It's a big problem because of many other people living in the building

author: Nicholas
comments: Great location, right near the metro. Todd was very accommodating of my travel schedule.

author: Nathan
comments: Fantastic location, great service and the owner was really responsive to any needs.

author: Stanley
comments: Todd's place is very conveniently located. Very easy to get to/from downtown. The place was highly efficient and clean. It was a great stay.

author: Lisa
comments: Great location, felt safe, very clean! We had a great stay at Todd’s place in Toronto.

author: Sierra
comments: Todd's apartment was in such a great spot in the city and exactly what we needed. Only minutes from Casa Loma which we recommend while visiting. Great apartment, highly recommend!

author: Seil
comments: Located in a quiet residential area but really close to U of T. The room I stayed in was clean and quiet. The bed was also super comfortable. Highly recommend for short stays.

author: Syd
comments: The space was even smaller and more cramped than expected and the location did not make up for the lack of facilities (no sink in the washroom).  The neighbours were noisy and the property was difficult to locate.  Not a good start to our stay in Toronto.

author: Jose
comments: Was definitely a good cozy place too stay and it is definitely nice too move into lol but a good experience there and love the pizzeria across the street! Wish the system heater was better but they provide tons of blankets!!

author: Maddie
comments: Darren & Derek really out-did themselves with their gem of a home. 10 minute, $10 USD Uber ride to get to and from the downtown area- the place is just far enough that it’s the perfect location for someone looking to be close to everything but not in the middle of the city. My friends and I travel to Toronto a lot, and we usually stay right in the city. I have to say, after staying at this beautiful place perfect for 2-4 people, stocked with snacks and drinks and any toiletry you need, next time I’m in Toronto I will definitely come back to Darren & Dereks. Super quick and helpful responses, we were even greeted in person and got a tour of the place when we arrived! They thought of everything and they put it all into this listing and I’m so glad I chose to stay here. Thank you both for making my weekend trip that much better!

author: Jennifer
comments: Darren and Derek are kind, thoughtful, and meticulous in the upkeep of their home. They were responsive and a pleasure to chat with when we were getting settled and then settled again, as we had a flight delay and added a day to our stay. They thought of everything and even reached out to us when the weather got bad since they knew we were flying out. Thank you again for such a great stay!

author: David
comments: Darren & Derek hosted us for a great weekend in Toronto.  The recently renovated rooms, beautiful rooftop area, and great location made for a memorable weekend.  Stylish furnishings and extra amenities added to a wonderful experience, thank you!

author: Will
comments:
Everything about this Airbnb was fantastic. We stayed here for 10 days and wanted for absolutely nothing during our stay. There were plenty of toiletries and bedding readily available, with a kitchen that was well-equipped with plenty of cookware as well as olive oil and seasonings for the food. Derek even sent up a care package full of snacks and extra towels to our room halfway through our stay!

Everything was exceptionally clean, stylish, and convenient, with a great location close to a grocery store and several restaurants, as well as being just a short drive from the downtown area.

Darren & Derek were incredibly gracious and accommodating during the entire visit, and I cannot possibly recommend this Airbnb enough.

author: (Email hidden by Airbnb)
comments: Excellent hosts

author: EHawk
comments: Beautiful apartment with all the touches of home, and so convenient for getting around the city. The hosts were very easy to get in touch with, very friendly and polite, offered suggestions, and also gave us plenty of space to do our thing. Only wish my vacation were longer!

author: Stephen (And Liz)
comments: Great location and amazing hospitality.  The place is well stocked with everything you expect and much more that you wouldn't expect.  Top notch place for sure.

author: Kenna
comments: We just spent four days at Darren and Derek's studio suite.  They were both very welcoming during the entire stay.  They had coffee, creamer, milk, bottled water, and snacks in the kitchen which was also stocked with pans and such to prepare a meal.  There was also a grill outside that we could use.  Private parking in the back was a definite plus.  I really liked the set-up of the space.  They had cable TV with a lot of channels, along with Netflix. The bathroom was a full bath with tub and shower.  The soap and shampoo they provided was very nice.  I especially liked that the bathroom had a medicine cabinet to store some of our things such as deodorant, Q-tips, etc.  There was also a window ledge in the bathroom that I used as additional space for hair spray and such.  They also have a washer and dryer that is available for doing laundry. The only drawback I could think of was that the bed was only a full size, so if you are a larger person it might make for a tight squeeze the way the bed is set up in the corner.   Otherwise, I cannot think of anything they could have done to make our stay any nicer.

author: Jesse
comments: Our favorite Airbnb we’ve ever stayed in! Derek and Darren left snacks, soaps, and anything you can think of for us to use. Very clean and comfortable and in walking distance to a really fun end of Toronto. Would definitely come back.

author: Cody
comments: Despite the good location, I would probably recommend staying elsewhere.

author: Vlad
comments: Great  placefor the price))

author: Bradley
comments: Awesome location and fairly spacious!

author: Jim
comments: good location

author: Dan Yahir
comments: Very well located place. Spencer always responded very fast which was very useful during the stay

author: Kribakaran
comments: Spencer's apartment is located on a prime location in Yorkville. The apartment was clean and as listed. Having an AC was very helpful as I was staying during the summer time. Additionally, Spencer was very quick in responding and always available to answer my questions. I will certainly stay again at this place. Thanks for a great stay Spencer!

author: Amara
comments: Great communication and seamless checkin. Area was nice, but not like the rest of downtown. No tv channels or streaming services so be prepared if staying in for a night. Overall great host

author: Marley
comments: super great location and super nice host!! would stay here again for sure!

author: Robert
comments: Clean, quiet, conveniently located apartment.

author: Shahriar
comments:
I was not able to get into spencer's place with the codes he provided. even though i told him i will arrive late at night, he did not reply at all to confirm everything will be ok. once i got there it was around 12, and i texted him on airbnb and also direclty called and texted him. he never bothered to answer until morning. even in the morning he did not apologize or anything, just asking me what happened. the area around the location smells so bad i never seen that anywhere else. anyways, i was on the street for 2 hours until i found another hotel.
even tho the codes were wrong(took a video, and also had neighbors try the codes), he told airbnb that all codes are correct. 
i definitely do not recommend him. he also advetises free parking in his listing but once i booked the place he asked me for extra money for the parking!

author: Bayuh
comments: If you ever need to stay somewhere,it is here

author: John
comments: I am somewhat reluctant to provide honest comments, for fear that I will be unable to get back in the future due to over subscription!  This place was absolutely perfect for me.  Modern, clean, super comfortable bed, great new appliances, outstanding in all regards, and what a view!  From the 56th floor you can see all over, Lake Ontario was interesting!  Access was rarely crowded, elevator set up was very good, and location next door to the Convention Center is perfect for attendees.  I walked to the Royal York and all over downtown.  This location is absolutely optimal.  Quiet, good heating and thoughtful lighting made the stay outstanding!

author: Patrick
comments: Awesome spot!

author: Christina
comments: Ben’s condo is clean, comfortable, and conveniently located downtown. Check-in is a little complicated because you have to get the keys before you can access the parking, but construction restricts street access to the building. That said, it is obviously very nice to have the convenience of a parking spot included in the rental.

author: Keith
comments: I had a great stay at this spot. I was in town for a week of work and it felt like being at home.  Ben was easy to reach, check-in/check-out was a breeze and the view was amazing. Great location close to the Toronto Harbor, CN Tower, Scotiabank Arena. Highly recommended!

author: Cutzi
comments: Location was great, apartment was cozy and all necessities were provided. Great place to stay in Toronto.

author: Jason
comments:
The location of this unit is centrally located to most activities around the Toronto area! The unit was very clean and had a warm welcoming feeling when you walked in the door. The view looking out over Toronto was absolutely spectacular from every angle you looked, if your looking for a nice warm welcoming unit this place has that all. 

Ben was a great host and was very quick with response, the parking helped immensely as you didn’t have to find parking in the city, and the security at the front desk made you feel safe. When arriving because of the current construction around the unit I recommend temporarily parking on Grand Trunk Cres. The unit is quite and high enough up you don’t hear any road or construction noise.

Recommend places to eat breakfast and dinner within walking distance, Evviva Breakfast and Cafe and Amsterdam BrewHouse.

author: Ash
comments: Excellent place and stay. Would certainly recommend to others. Everything was as advertised!

author: Seth
comments: Great place to stay for a few days while visiting the city!

author: Amanda
comments: The apartment is beautiful and in a great location. Walking distance to many restaurants and stores, it was an amazing place to stay for our first time in Toronto! Would definitely stay here again.

author: Austin
comments: It's a great place to stay if your working around the area.

author: Jacob
comments:
This place includes everything that you would need for a stay in Toronto. It’s close to public transportation and downtown. It provides most basic amenities one would need. Quiet home in a quiet neighborhood. For the price, you can’t top it. Had the pleasure of meeting Mike and he was also such a fantasticly friendly host. 

If I am lucky, I’ll absolutely be back to Mike’s place on my next visit to Toronto. Looking for the best deal possible? Go no further.

author: Will
comments:
The place is nice, but be aware there are numerous other people renting the other rooms at the same time. Still, this place is a steal. For the price point and location, you can forgive the cosmetic defects in the house and the lack of the host's physical presence. All ammenities were accounted for including a nicely fitted bed, a desk, Wi-Fi, and a community kitchen. Would visit again!

For those desiring a hotel quality suite, though, look elsewhere and increase your price point.

author: James
comments: Mike is very helpful and great in communication.

author: Selda
comments: Mike was kind and very helpful. I always reached him when I needed. His place is clean and comfortable and it is very well-organized; you can see all the information you need in related places. The location is quite good; it is not very close to the downtown but very easy to reach through the subway. I also like the neighbourhood. The only problem I could say is about the air conditioner. It was too noisy.

author: Anya
comments: I enjoyed the stay, would definitely stay there again!

author: Himanshu
comments: Easy check in/out.  Great little cozy attic.

author: Annie
comments: The place is great for if you want to get your own space but on a budget. If you're tired of hostels, this is the place for you!

author: Nathan
comments: Mike is a great host.. And also great with communication. The room is exactly how it is explained and the neighborhood is safe and convient for all things. I will definitely be back!

author: Hyunkyo
comments: I  stayed there for 5 nights and was very nice and it's find place. Mike answered me every question very kindly I highly recommend to everyone

author: Petar
comments:
Andrew’s place was great. Exactly what I needed in this moment. It was clean and had a very comfortable bed. Bathroom was clearly very clean and newly renovated which was great. There was a mini fridge, kettle (with free coffee and tea), washer/dryer, and a microwave. He even provided towels which was amazing.

Andrew also gave me the option of remotely adjusting the temperature which was amazing. Toronto basements can be pretty cold in the winter/fall so that was a much appreciated luxury. All-in-all I give this place a 4.5-5 out 5 for me. 

One word of warning. It can be the case in Toronto homes that sound travels so if you’re a sensitive sleeper maybe have some earplugs. This is the perfect spot to drop your things, get some rest and then head out and explore the rest of Toronto.

Thanks Andrew!

author: Austin
comments: Great place, very clean and inviting. Room description was accurate and Andrew did a great job of providing parking options since you can’t park at the Airbnb.

author: Patrice
comments: Andrew's place was great. My husband and I appreciated the location because we didn't want to be downtown, but were still very close to metro transit and some great restaurants. Check in was as easy as it gets, and the space was cozy and quiet. Parking is a bit tricky in Toronto, but Andrew gave us some recommendations and we ended up getting lucky with free overnight street parking. The ceilings might prove a bit low if you're tall, but we're about average height and were just fine. Easy and comfortable overall!

author: Moe
comments: It is nice and clean but the thing is it is not as it is mentioned that is not the entire place and it is not separated.  for me i do not mind if there is no kitchen cuz i do not cook lol.  the roof is a little bit low in the bathroom maybe cuz i am tall. I do not mind to walk from the parking but it was freezing cold and I had to find a parking spot and walk back. but like i said the place is super clean and smells nice and easy to communicate and easy check in and check out.

author: Roy
comments: It’s a nice and clean spot just not an entire home besides that everything was nice

author: Ally
comments: Great location! Walking distance to the Danforth & even the Danforth Music Hall (a little bit farther but a nice wander). The space was clean & cozy. Andrew was quick to offer parking & restaurant tips, making our stay a breeze! Highly recommend :)

author: Djilan
comments: Great place

author: Lauren
comments: Stayed at Andrew's basement for one night, good communication and check-in instructions were clear. The bed was comfy and the couch area next to the bed is spacious and comfortable as well. Everything was clean, the only issue I saw was the driveway leading up to the entrance down to the basement, rubble everywhere. The host should fix this issue right away before winter when the surface becomes slippery.

author: Adam
comments: We had a great nights  stay at Andrews. The unit was very clean and comfortable. One thing to note is the extremely low ceilings, watch your head... Other than that it was fantastic. Would recommend.

author: Justin
comments: Andrew’s place was a nice, cozy spot. It’s conveniently located with plenty of food options nearby - as well as plenty of stores for pretty much anything you may need to grab. The waterfront is close by and downtown Toronto is only a 10-15 minute drive as well. I would stay at Andrew’s place again in the future.

author: Ziqian
comments: Great location and thoughtful design.

author: Kelly
comments: Very clean, hosts were nice. Check in was easy and the location was amazing.

author: Blake
comments: Very clean, modern, and stylish with a great view of the CN Tower. Great hosts with helpful and quick responses. Would definitely stay here again!

author: Rashawna
comments: This unit was in a very very convenient location. In close walking distance to everything you may want to see or anything you may need. Check in and check out instructions were very clear. Hosts responses were very fast to any questions. Parking garage was helpful with clear entry instructions. And most of all very comfortable, clean, and stylish condo!

author: Malik
comments: Location location location. This place was perfect and had the view to match. Unit was clean everything was perfect. Cozy space and the host was great  no complaints

author: Rosalee
comments: Great place to stay! Central location, nice atmosphere, would stay here again!

author: James
comments: Wonderful location with great amenities in the building. Was within walking distance to most of the main hotspots and had a great view of the cn tower. Everything was modern and clean — having parking on the premises made things a breeze

author: Haley
comments: This place was amazing! Such a good host and quick to respond. The place was centralized, which made it super easy to get around to places. Very clean and overall a great experience!

author: David
comments: Location, location, location.  Place is clean and secure.  Perfect for a couple visiting Toronto.

author: Tania
comments: Erin & Carole's place was wonderful. It was clean, in a wonderful location, and such a great find. We were able to walk to almost everywhere we wanted to go. Perfect amount of space for two people and the perfect place for a weekend getaway!

author: Bitty
comments: Antonio and Rainbow were very hospitable and the room was really clean.

author: Austin
comments: Friendly and attentive hosts, quick responses and clear and simple check in/out. The space is quite small but provided everything I needed for my short stay. Thank you!

author: Imtiyaz
comments: It is a decent place to stay.

author: Ozan
comments: This is a great place for last-minute flight cancelations and overnight flight connections. My flight is canceled and I booked the room for the same day. The hosts were kind enough to clean the room and get it ready during the day. It was a great stay. Also, the bed is very comfortable.

author: Nuno
comments: Great place. Clean and comfortable.

author: Sarah
comments: Room was exactly as advertised. Rainbow was a great host, very fun to talk to!

author: Jennifer
comments: Comfortable place and and very good communication with the hosts.

author: Ashfaq
comments: Affordable place to stay.

author: Kate
comments:
Antonio & Rainbow are excellent people and are experts at hosting, providing all the info you need before you think to ask questions! Very kind and hospitable : )

If you’re looking to stay here and commute into Toronto every day, budget for an easy enough 10-15 minute walk to the train stop (less fun when carrying luggage) & a CAN$5 fare. Looked like there was plenty of street parking available, if you have a car with you.

author: Aimy
comments:
We only stayed for a night but had a great experience. Antonio greeted us upon checking in even though it was 1am. The room was nice and quiet and we slept well. It was easy to walk to the UP Station the next morning to get into the city.
Thanks for having us!

author: Vinh
comments: Awesome place. Comfortable. Clean. Good location near a nice park with small beach.

author: Natalie
comments: Andrey was such a lovely host! The studio was really cute and well kept. My boyfriend and I had a great time.

author: Francisco
comments: Andrey's place was as advertised. Very convenient, parking spot, and had everything needed for my stay.

author: Viktoria
comments: Great place. Very convenient and had everything I needed for my stay.

author: Kierra
comments: Very friendly host, had great recommendations about the town and great conversation

author: Seyi
comments: Highly recommend! A few minutes walk to a local grocery store that’s open late, and close to public transportation that takes you into downtown. The place is quaint and comfortable, and is near a nice park too! Would stay again!

author: Brittany
comments: Audrey was a wonderful host!

author: Jesus
comments: Andrey’s place is not hard to find, if you fly in from YYZ, take the public transit TTC from the airport to the Kipling Station, and then the connection to be dropped off at Lake Shore Blvd. (you only need to pay once!, it’s $3.25 CAD and $2.10 CAD if you are a student, connections are free until you reach your destination) when you reach Lake Shore Blvd you are only 7 minutes walking distance from the bus stop to the Air BnB. There is a Rabba foods open 24/7 right at the corner of where you will be staying (only 2 blocks away) just in case you need to buy anything or pay a visit to the Tim Hortons inside to get a pastry or some coffee (they are open from 7am-11pm if I’m not mistaken.) from the bus stop right in front of the Rabba/Tim Hortons you can take the 510 all the way to downtown where the CN Tower is, or St. Lawrence Market (again, same price as you pay from the airport to the Air BnB, what a deal!). Now onto the actual room, it’s a quiet place, very clean, Andrey had a working coffee machine and sugar there, even some cream for you to get your morning caffeine fix. The bed was comfortable, all of the plugs worked, we didn’t watch much TV, but it was nice to put on the local news each morning while we were getting ready. The Radiator in the room keeps it real warm in the winter, and there is a washing machine and a dryer in the next room that you can use if you are staying a few days (but have your coins ready, it’s $1.50 CAD to wash, and $1.75 CAD to dry, really worth it for a large load of laundry). Now I’m sure I mentioned it was clean, but again I must say it was clean, there were nice soft bath towels and hand towels to use and to top it off, there was even shampoo and bars of soap (Dove and Irish Spring). There was even a large bowl of candy just in case you need a sugar pick me up which was really nice. The WiFi was fast, there is no ironing board, but in the winter all you need to do is plug in the iron that is there and give it a quick pass since you will be all covered up with your coats, scarves, and gloves (layer up in the winter, even your socks, you don’t want to freeze). I’ve rambled on enough, Andrey was a gentleman, a professional, and above all treats you like a friend. We really appreciated the stay and when we visit Toronto again, we will definitely be staying here. It’s a small place, a great value, and totally worth it.

author: Pyren
comments: Perfect location to downtown Toronto.

author: Jackie
comments: Awesome! Great communication, location is outstanding and Andrey is very friendly. Would recommend!

author: Brittany
comments: Great spot near Dupont subway station. Very clean, comfy bed and sheets, the parking spot is a great amenity. Will definitely stay again!

author: Sarah
comments: John’s place was clean and close to areas we wanted to go to. We walked to Koreatown and utilized Uber and Lyft.

author: Mariya
comments: Very good for the price. Great location, not in the basement so no issues with low ceilings.

author: Thuly
comments: A lovely and quiet place to stay in Toronto. The offered parking space is greatly appreciated and the location is perfect. Super close to all the places that we were planning on visiting and is definitely a great place for two people. I love all the extra pillows and tiny touches around the place and the check in process was the most easiest! Totally recommended and we would stay here again if we’re back in Toronto.

author: John
comments: Nice place, location is good to get to downtown, apartment is clean enough. Pretty much as advertised.

author: Maria
comments: We stayed 3 nights and only were in the apt. for sleeping so it worked well for us. It is small but the location is good with a subway stop one block away. We did not use the kitchenette at all but it is available if needed. Several places nearby for breakfast coffee and lunch or dinner. The off street parking place was great as we did not want to use our car in the city. it is a good value in an expensive city. Thank you, John!

author: Sydney
comments: John's place was very clean and in a great location, especially if you plan to use the subway. The space was great for what we were looking for, which was a simple place to sleep. John also provided great communication and even let us check in a bit earlier than usual. Would definitely recommend to anyone planning to travel to Toronto and looking for a reasonably priced place to stay.

author: Yutong
comments: John’s place is located right next to Dupont station, which is less than 15 min metro ride to downtown area. The apartment is in the back of a building. It is small but cozy. The amenities are complete

author: Justin
comments: Great stay and location

author: Joe
comments: Fast communication, easy parking and check-in. The apartment is close to the subway and had everything I needed, and the bed was very comfortable. Thanks John!

author: Zack
comments: Helen is very prompt on her communication. The space is great with a view that would be hard to beat. I’d recommend to anyone enjoying some time in a Toronto.

author: Hannah
comments: The view is absolutely out of this world! We've stayed in toronto about 5 to 6 times in the past year and this was by far best view yet. Blown away. Place was clean. Easy to get to. Host communicates well. Definately recommend!

author: Ken
comments: Helen has a great spot in Toronto. Very close to both Scotiabank and Rogers arenas. I'll definitely stay again next time I'm in Toronto

author: John
comments: I love the view from Helen’s apartment, this is the third time I have stayed at her place.  Great location.

author: Maksym
comments: undebatable best view in Toronto!)

author: John
comments: I love Helen’s place, this was a return visit.  The view from the high floor is very cool, check in is super easy, the location right next to Union station with grocery store across the street is super convenient, and Helen is super responsive on communication.  I had such a positive experience, thank you Helen!

author: Alysha
comments: Helen’s place was an amazing place to stay for our girls weekend in Toronto. The view was absolutely spectacular!

author: Matthew
comments: Helens place is amazing! When I walked into the Airbnb, what caught my attention was how clean it was! Everything was perfect! The view is amazing, and the parking was not too hard to find! I enjoyed every second of the apartment while I was in there! If I could give Helen 10 stars I would! If you’re going to stay in Toronto and you want a CN Tower view! There’s nothing better than Helen’s apartment! I will definitely be staying here again!

author: Sue
comments: Spectacular views!  Windows all around and we were on the 51st floor.  Having floors and no carpet is a welcome sight.  Kitchen is lacking a few things if you are eating in.  Location is great to Union station, bus stops, (Website hidden by Airbnb) Tower right outside your window!  Pretty clean space and nice floor plan for 2 couples.  Seating not so great for our husbands but we made do.

author: Brandon
comments: Excellent place to stay in Toronto! Highly recommend!

author: Amit
comments:
Clean
Efficient
Responsive
Great location and quiet area
Quality stay

author: Benjamin
comments: Great stay

author: Tenisha
comments:
Great place, amazing value. Cozy for a single traveler. Great location. 

Todd's place is a great value when traveling in Toronto. Not far from the subway and neighborhood shops. 

Thoughtful touches made staying here very nice. Great communication before, during and after the reservation.

author: Jodi
comments: Very clean space and very clear directions on how to get in with a responsive host. The space is very small for two people and the walls are thin so you can hear everyone in the apartment complex which wasn’t a huge issue.  Though was not expensive which is appropriate.

author: Nhi
comments: Todd’s place is cozy, elegantly decorated and conveniently located. On top of that, Todd is a wonderful host. He was not only quick to respond, but also quick to come to my aid when I got locked out of the apartment despite it being 10pm on a Sunday night. Definitely recommend!

author: Tavi
comments: The little room was as described in the photos. It's in a fantastic location near the university and the metro. As other reviewers noted, the walls are paper thin: you can hear full conversations, sneezes, etc. It was clean, although the bathroom wall had several dead bugs on it. The WiFi and the heat worked well. Overall, our needs were met.

author: Jordan
comments: Uncomfortable matress, very noisy, could be worse

author: David
comments: Awesome stay, was very short notice but Todd accommodated me in no time, will stay again!

author: Deanna
comments: The studio was great and exactly how it was pictured! It was very clean as well and the hosts were super responsive. There were not many amenities so it is quite a simple space, but worked perfectly for our short trip! Would definitely book again!

author: Matthew
comments: Clean area great host.

author: Sue
comments: Great place!

author: Dejah
comments: Great stay! Conveniently located & cozy dwelling.

author: Jessica
comments: Loved this space! It was cute and very clean! Check in was super easy and it was a great location, super close to the Eaton Centre!

author: Nate
comments: Last minute booking and they were super responsive with info. Cheap and cheerful option for downtown TO.

author: Dr. Lyron H.
comments: The place is conveniently located near where I needed to work. The group was quick to respond to my requests.

author: Mauricio
comments: A very well located apartment. Easy to access and well maintained. It was a nice experience.

author: Stefan
comments: Good place to stay for a night! Very prompt responses from the host and easy instructions to follow.

author: Olivia
comments: only downside is loud construction starting early but besides that its a good spot!

author: Sepehr
comments: Had a great time, great host with amazing prompt communication!

author: Emma
comments: A small, cute, and quiet location, close to many downtown Toronto locations

author: Craig
comments: I was comfortable with all aspects of this reservation

author: Prakash
comments: It's a affordable place with a great location to explore the city.

author: Aoife
comments: Great location, perfect place to base yourself for a weekend exploring the city! Close to everything!

author: Peixe
comments: It was a very nice and stylish place. It was cozy, and very close to the Dufferin station. Rosie was very quick to respond to my phone calls. It is a nice place for a short stay, for one to two people.

author: Maddie
comments: Very clean space! I had a slight issue with the check-in process of not having the right key in the lock box, but it was resolved within ten minutes of arrival. There is a coffee shop right next door which is great. The space is small, but not much smaller than a typical hotel room; both myself and fiancé were very comfortable there for the weekend. This is a very walkable neighborhood. We were able to park on the street  just around the corner the whole weekend without getting a ticket. On the Toronto city website, the rule is 3 hr street parking, but only enforced if someone complains. 10 minute walk from cool stores, bars, and a few improv theaters. You can't beat this price for such a clean and convenient space.

author: Constance
comments: Location is perfect - walking distance to places to eat and things to do on Bloor. Place is clean, and tidy. Wouldn’t have more than 2 people due to size, but it was perfect for our trip.

author: Adam
comments: We enjoyed our stay here. Great location, very close to the subway. Overall the space was clean and we were comfortable. It was a little smaller than expected, especially the washroom, but it was fine for our 3 day stay.

author: Dennis
comments:
Nice place! Of all the places I've used AirBNB, this is the first one that had the most consistent wi-fi, which was really helpful because an unholy amount of storms hit Toronto one day, leaving me stranded.. Granted, the place is small and is a sofa bed but I found it fine and perfect for solo travelers. 

The only minor complaint I have is the parking is in this really awkward driveway, but considering there was a FREE space to parking my car somewhere in Toronto...I should be more grateful than anything else

author: Landon
comments:
Rosie’s place we a great space for my wife and I’d 2-day stay in Toronto. As many others have mentioned, the space is somewhat small, but there’s plenty of room for 1-2 people. The studio is trimmed-out nicely on the inside with granite countertops, nice fixtures & appliances, and pretty decor.
     The biggest positive regarding Rosie’s place is the location. It’s within minutes of Toronto’s downtown, Old Toronto, and most of the main places in the city to visit...
     The biggest opportunity would be the bathroom storage space. There’s no shelving or counter-space  on which to place your toiletries or other items. Not a huge deal, but you’ll have to improvise a little here. Also, yes the bed isn’t the most comfortable being a couch pull-out... but, it does the job.
     Overall, I would definitely recommend staying at Rosie’s place during a visit to Toronto.

author: Alex
comments: Excellent location near metro station

author: Luzette
comments: This place was super stylish and had a great view. It had everything we needed, however the host's manual was a bit intimidating with all the extra charges for additional amenities and/or damage to property. Just be extra careful and this place is the perfect place to unwind after exploring Toronto!

author: Connor
comments: Nice apartment, everything you need in the apartment. Thanks!

author: Jake
comments: 12/10 view of the city. This place is perfect for a short weekend get away. It’s very secure and easy access to the city.

author: Sally
comments: Park your car when you get in and leave it. Walk everywhere!  Clean apartment.

author: Mimi
comments: Gorgeous space with a lovely view! Easy access and close to everything downtown. If you’re looking for a cozy and modern place downtown Toronto, I would highly recommend!

author: Jacob
comments: This is a beautiful apartment. Very nicely decorated and with amazing views. In a perfect location as well

author: Mary
comments: Had a great stay here! The condo was nicely decorated, clean, and felt like home! Chintan & Preet provided helpful information before and during my stay, and were very easy to communicate with!

author: Ceina
comments: Great place with an even better view! Location is right where you want to be if you are visiting the city. Very convenient and easy to find plus parking is included. Would recommend.

author: Sarah
comments: Apartment was much smaller than appeared in photos, however, it met our needs for our trip just fine. Underground parking was a bit of a hassle because of our large truck. We made due and it was nice having a place to keep the car during our stay.

author: Ja Lissa
comments: Great location. Naturally chilly in the home during the colder months due to the floor to ceiling windows. However, the windows offered STUNNING views - so I didn't mind the chilliness that much!

author: Mai
comments:
Paul's place was great. Good size. Great area and super convenient for all kinds of shops, restaurants and groceries. It was clean, tidy, and had a lot of things I needed during my stay for a weekend. I was able to do some cooking, laundry and enjoyed the internet and cable provided. Paul was also kind enough to allow a flexible check out time (dependant on any of vacancy).

The lockbox was a bit tricky to find, but luckily I was able to leave my things with the nice security team (in the lobby) before I went on a mission to track it down.

Easy check in and out.

Would recommend this place and would definitely rebook in the future. 

Thanks Paul.

author: Barbara And Jeff
comments: Clean and comfortable lodging.  I would stay there again.

author: Irene
comments: Great space in midtown!

author: Vonneicia
comments: The experience was amazing. Easy check in/out. Very clean, perfect location!

author: M. Abbas
comments: Excellent location. Comes with covered parking. Quick responses and clean apartment. Definitely recommended.

author: Menachem
comments: Paul's space was perfect. We'll situated, very clean, and so full of light!

author: Maben
comments: Great host who is super attentive and the unit is spotless.  Great location and comfortable. Very modern.

author: Jaaron
comments: This was a great place to stay. Sparkling clean and in a perfect location. I really enjoyed my stay.

author: Jeffrey
comments: The location is terrific; plenty of restaurants and services nearby including a grocery store in the same building. Subway access is a block away. So, the condo is a great base for exploring the city without the need and hassle of a car. (The included parking spot is a big plus.) The condo space itself is pleasant; very light and open. The condo furnishings could use an upgrade; the kitchen table stools, couch and chair - while newish - are cheap and uncomfortable. Also, the outdoor deck patio needs furniture; it isn’t much of an amenity without the ability to sit down. But we were there to explore the city, not to lounge around the condo. So, it worked well for us.

author: Steven
comments: Place was in a great location and was perfect for two.  The patio is a great place to view some of the city skyline.  Parking and checkin were easy. Would definitely stay here again.

author: Randy
comments: Good value, good location, good communication. You get what you pay for, though. The place was far from perfect. Could have been cleaner. The bed and furniture were ikea. The wood slats that hold up the bed’s mattress kept falling, like ikea beds are known for. Not the most comfortable, but host was very good with communicating and trying to offer solutions.

author: Christopher
comments: It was a very nice space with respectful people and a pretty location in the city!

author: Lauren
comments: A clean, quiet, comfortable space, and perfectly located! I had a wonderful stay.

author: Hazel
comments: Unexpectedly amazing experience. Recommend.

author: Charlotte
comments: I had a great stay at Michal’s! It’s close to Yonge Street, so there were things to do in the area. It’s close to the subway station so easy to get to the downtown area. I definitely recommend Michal’s place for a budget traveler!

author: Tyler
comments: Prime location. Great price. Right next to the train station/buses to get Downtown Toronto. If you enjoy walking, it’s not that bad of a walk to downtown.

author: Tanja Katarina
comments: If ever I'll be back in Toronto I will stay in Mike's place again. You can use the kitchen and the subway is just less than 10 minutes walk. The place has a great neighborhood and is really quiet.

author: Drew
comments: Everything was great!

author: Jinwoo
comments: very clean, cozy space.

author: Charles
comments:
Mike's place is so close to the city! Real close to the subway station so easy to get downtown, or if you're like me and you like to hike around it's only a couple miles to get to some of the big city biz. Right next to Mikes place (we're talking a block or two) are some of the benefits of city living - pharmacy, cafes, a plethora of restaurants, etc. There's even a cat cafe! 

Having a whole room to yourself at this price in this proximity to the city is PRIME. Will definitely be visiting again if I am ever in the toronto area!

author: Paola
comments:
Great experience!!! My host was very wonderful, she even pick me up from the Billy Bishop Airport, first time a host does that for me. 
The place was clean, very close to everything and perfect for the days that I was going to be in Toronto. 
I will definitely come back!

author: Kathaleen
comments: Nice place with a amazing view of the CN tower and great location.

author: Chelsea
comments:
Excellent location - can’t beat the distance to transportation, CN Tower and the Scotiabank Arena. 

Place needs some updates and bit of cleaning up.

author: Kendall
comments: This was my second time staying at this unit and it was outstanding the second time around too. It is in a great location, very clean, and Nancy is a terrific host!

author: Archer
comments: This unit has a great location and is very convenient to downtown Toronto and the waterfront. The unit has a great view but is a bit on the small side and shows it's age a bit but is not bad for the price and nicer than hotels costing 4x in the area. The wifi didn't work when I arrived but the owner was super responsive and did everything he could to get it fixed as fast as possible and it was working by Wed. However I did feel I had to take a star off the rating for that reason.

author: Eric
comments: Pretty good value - good location - nice view. Memory foam mattress and kinda large pillows. During our stay 2 or the 3 elevators were broken so it took a while to get out of the building - but I don’t think the host has any control over that.

author: LaVita
comments: Great view!

author: Courtney
comments: Great location, great communication from host. Comfortable bed but could definitely use a new set of sheets

author: Paul
comments: Great location and good value for the money

author: Torsten
comments: Fantastic location, great view from the panoramic windows as well the balcony. Great places to eat nearby, e.g. Amsterdam Brewhouse and Trattoria Mercator.

author: Tessa
comments:
CJ’s apartment was an incredible place to stay while in Toronto. The bed was RIDICULOUSLY soft and the apartment was sparkling clean with everything you could ever ask for in the kitchen.

Plus, rainfall shower. Enough said.

Great value. Would recommend this apartment to anyone and would be happy to stay there again myself.

Thank you, CJ!!!
